This is her fourth loan with MFP and she's happy about the financial help to make progress with her business.  For this reason she promises to make her payments on time, as with the previous loans.  In addition, she comments that she's comfortable with her communal bank because she considers it to be a close and supportive group.

She will invest the requested 1500 nuevos soles [PEN] in buying the latest styles of women's shoes, bringing them from another city where she gets the lowest prices for buying wholesale.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Florencia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a la producción y el comercio mayorista de verduras como legumbres y hortalizas, y lo distribuyen en los diferentes mercados de la región, pero también a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, con estas actividades nuestra socia saca adelante a su familia. Florencia en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar algunos productos como tomates, cebollas y zanahorias para surtir su oferta.
Florencia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our partner Florencia belongs to the Communal Bank "Reyna de los Angeles" in the Urubamba province in Cusco, Peru. She makes a living producing and selling vegetables  and beans wholesale. She distributes them throughout different markets in the region. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. With these jobs, she carries her family forward. In this opportunity she will invest the loan requested to buy some products such as tomatoes, onions and carrots to stock up her products. 

Florencia is very thankful for Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and to grow and strengthen her work. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to making the payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.ru:
Мария осталась одна, без мужа, когда дети были еще маленькие. Она начала свой бизнес на небольшом рынке. Некоторое время торговала на другом рынке - большом центральном городском рынке. 

Несмотря на больший торговый оборот, аренда торгового места была слишком дорогой. Мария переехала обратно на крытый рынок, сейчас имеет желание купить еще один киоск, чтобы увеличить объем продаж. 

Мария торгует одеждой для женщин среднего возраста. Просит предоставить ей кредит на летние сарафаны.
texts.en: Maria became single when her children were still yong. She started her own business at a small market. For a while she had been working at a different market — the large central city market. Despite her large sales turnover, the rent for the shop stall was too high. Maria moved over to the covered market, and would now like to buy another stall to increase her sales. Maria sells cothes for middle-aged women. She would like a loan to buy summer dresses.

loans.use: to buy women's summer dresses

loans.name: Lillie

texts.en:
As part of her family tradition, Lillie learned to cook as a child. Lessons from her grandmother and mother led to the opening of her start-up restaurant, "Soul Heaven Café". After conducting customer research, Lillie leased a building in her hometown of Mobile, Alabama, that’s surrounded by multiple businesses where soul food has little competition other than a couple of nearby fast food restaurants.

Besides her knowledge of cooking from scratch from her family, Lillie worked for a major Italian chain restaurant that sent her to culinary school. She also managed multiple restaurants. She says corporate always wants what’s best for it rather than the customer. “What I have learned from managing other businesses is you have to jump through hoops. It’s not about the customer, it’s about the dollar,” she says. Lillie plans to do just the opposite with her restaurant. She is starting out small to ensure she can properly cater to customers’ needs. When she opens in the middle of July, her restaurant will be the only one in her area offering made-from-scratch breakfast before 11 a.m.

Since her business is a start-up, Lillie is the only employee. The restaurant is modeled after a take-out establishment, but can comfortably sit 15 hungry customers. She says Soul Heaven Café will create four new jobs when it kicks off, but, for the time being, she’ll receive help from family when needed. Lillie’s menu will consist of a variety of dishes, including chef salad, chicken salad, grilled or fried chicken sandwiches, fish sandwiches, vegetables, fruits, wings, and homemade cakes and puddings. She will also offer daily specials and party platters. 

To get started, Lillie needed more kitchen equipment. But knowing she might not qualify for a loan, she purchased cooking equipment progressively until she inquired about a loan. Lillie says she did a quick Google search for loans in her area and came across Accion Texas Inc. However, she didn’t follow through with an application until the Alabama Women in Business organization encouraged her. The Accion loan will help her business flourish, as she is able to purchase equipment and offer more menu choices, she says. Without the loan, it would have taken Lillie longer to open. “I would like to thank Accion for believing in my dreams and helping me achieve my dreams.” She is currently in the process of obtaining the domain name for her future website, but has a Facebook page for now: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Soul-Heaven-Cafe/203786046407460.

loans.use: to pay for kitchen equipment

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has three children. Her husband is a brick layer. Ama sells bread and eggs near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for 10 years. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Ama will use this loan to purchase flour and eggs. With the new profits, Ama plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour and eggs

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
Maseray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Maseray was born in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. She is married to a motor mechanic and the couple has 3 children – 2 of whom are attending secondary school and the other is not of school-going age.  Maseray sells secondhand motor spare parts and has been doing this business for 8 years now.

With the help of this loan, Maseray and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Maseray will use her share of the loan (1,800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy used spare parts for motors at wholesale for resale.

loans.use: to buy used spare parts for motors for resale

loans.name: Have Faith In God Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Marie was born in Tonkolili district, Northern Sierra Leone 38 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Marie sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) and has been doing this business for 10 years now.

With the help of this loan, Marie and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Marie will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy palm oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba est une femme mariée , mère de quatre enfants.Elle s'occupe à longueur de journée des taches ménagères.Depuis quelques mois, elle pratique l'embouche bovine à domicile afin d'obtenir des revenus pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter un boeuf.
texts.en: Daba is married, and a mother of 4. All day, she takes care of the house. For a few months now, she has undertaken a cattle fattening activity at home in order to get an income to meet her needs and that of her children. She is asking for a 200 000f loan in order to buy a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El socio Martin nació en el departamento de Puno pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la venta de manejeria de forma ambulatorio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar botones, agujas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: The borrower Martin was born in the department of Puno but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 38 years old and has a common law marriage from which he has two children. He belongs to the communal bank “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” and is doing very well thanks to the punctual payments of the fees. He works moving about as a traveling salesman and at this time needs a loan to buy buttons, needles and other things. He has been in this business for some years and it is going very well. The member is grateful for the loan and he agrees to comply with the payment of his fees in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy buttons, needles and other things

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Juliet has a beauty salon that offers hair relaxing, hair rebonding, manicures and pedicures. Aside from that she also sells beauty products and personal care products. She has run this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy materials to use in her beauty salon and to pay for electricity for the salon.
Juliet has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants.Il pratique l'élevage traditionnel depuis son jeune âge.Toutefois, depuis ces dernières années, les nombreux problèmes que connaît ce type d'élevage l'ont obligé à changer de pratique et à faire de l'embouche bovine.Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse puis revend au bout de 7 mois.Cette activité lui permet de générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Actuellement il sollicite un pret de 350 0000f de l'UIMCEC pour acheter un boeuf et des aliments bétail.Il ambitionne d'agrandir d'avantage sa capacité d'élevage.
texts.en: Ousmane is married and a father of 4. He has practiced traditional livestock farming since his youth. However, since the last few years, given the many problems linked to this type of farming, he has been forced to switch to cattle fattening. He buys bulls which he fattens, then resells them after 7 months. This activity has enabled him to generate an income substantial enough to meet his family's needs, as well as his own. He is currently asking for a 350 0000f loan from UIMCEC in order to buy a bull and cattle feed. His goal is to expand his farming capacity.

loans.use: to buy a bull and cattle feed.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.en:
María Consuelo is 31 years old and married with four children.  She lives in northern Peru with her husband and children in the rural area of the Tambogrande District, Piura Province.

María raises sheep, poultry and pigs in a place close to her house. She fattens them with balanced feed and when they have reached an adequate level of development, she sells them to her neighbors and to the merchants who come to her place. This business activity allows her to help her family with the daily expenses. 

María has also developed a passion for farming and she primarily grows lemons. She harvests the lemons and then sells them to her neighbors. They buy her products because of the reliability and good quality. María always works hard to be able to get her family ahead.

María has successfully repaid a previous Kiva-funded loan, and this will be her second.  She plans to use this loan to buy more balanced feed for her livestock, as well as fertilizers for her lemon crop. She has proven to be a responsible person who knows her business well and wants to take advantage of potential opportunities in her area of work.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock, and fertilizers for a lemon crop

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 50 years old and the widowed mother of four children. She lives in the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she makes a living by providing beauty services to local community members. She's been in this business for 16 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,900 to buy more of the supplies she needs to run her business. Amelita joined GDMPC in 2009 as a way to improve her business and one day buy a house and a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her transportation business.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie, from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 23 years old and single. To make a living, for the past two years Elmie has owned and operated a motorcycle transportation service, earning 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elmie joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Diégane

texts.fr:
Diégane est un homme marié, père de deux enfants.Il est agriculteur mais pratique en même temps l'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine.Il achète un bœuf qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de 7 mois.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Afin de réaliser une nouvelle opération d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter 1 bœuf.

Son ambition est réaliser un enclos assez moderne pour élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Diégane is married and a father of 2. He is a farmer, but at the same time, pratices cattle fattening. He buys a bull which he fattens and resells after 7 months. This activity generates an income substantial enough to provide for his family.

For his next fattening operation, he is applying for a 250 000f loan so he can buy 1 bull.

His ambition is to build a fairly modern enclosure to expand his activity.

loans.use: to buy 1 bull.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora judith, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Angeles” de la provincia de Urubamba en Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, actividad que viene realizando hace mucho tiempo y con la cual saca adelante a su familia. Judith en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar algunos cuyes y gallinas, pero también lo que le quede ahorrará, porque ella posee una cultura del ahorro.
Judith está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower is Judith. She belongs to the communal bank “Reyna de los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) from the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Perú. The borrower continues raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens, an activity that she has been doing for a long time and with which she can move her family ahead. Judith at this time wants to invest the requested loan to buy some guinea pigs and chickens, but also she wants to save what is left, because she is in the habit of saving.

Judith is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give a better quality of life to her family and for helping her with the growth and strengthening of her activities. The borrower is grateful for the loan and she agrees to complete her payment of fees according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs and to be able to save

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo, 27 years old, single and living in the Philippines, has been providing motorela or motorcycle services for five years now. A member of HSPFI since 2012, he is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline. In the future, Alfredo hopes to improve his services so he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Saoya's Group

texts.en:
Saoya lives in a village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang, Cambodia. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom are still dependants. Saoya earns a living as a rice farmer and supplements her income by selling groceries. She has been in business for five years and earns about KHR 26,000 per day. Her main challenge is a lack of capital. 

Saoya is a member of a two-person loan group which has taken out and repaid three previous loans from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. These past loans have helped her improve her family's living conditions. This group is now applying for a new loan from VisionFund for KHR 1,400,000 per person. As the leader, Saoya is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm and also use some of it to plow her land. She hopes to earn more income from her business so that she and her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for a farm.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Loren, from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For the past five years Loren has owned and operated a general store selling a variety of products such as milk, vinegar, canned goods, etc. in the local community. She earns 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Loren joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 11,900 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Pacincia

texts.en: For the past two years Pacincia, a 62-year-old widowed mother of two grown children living in Bintangan, Larena, Siquijor, has managed her own piggery business to earn a living.  A member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year, she has requested a loan a PHP 4000 to purchase feeds and medicines for her enterprise. Pacincia hopes to renovate her house from her business profits.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicines for backyard piggery business.

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en:
Von lives in a village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang, Cambodia. She is 58 years old and the widowed mother of seven children. For the last nine years, she has supported her family by growing rice on her one-hectare farm. She earns about KHR 22,200 per day, and her main challenges are the low price of rice and recent flooding. 

Von leads a two-person loan group, and has taken out and repaid six previous loans from Kiva's partner VisionFiund. The other member of this group is taking out her third loan. Past loans have helped Von better support her family and save money for the future. This group is applying for a loan of KHR 800,000 for each member. Von will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm and plow her land. She hopes to increase her crop yields so that she can earn enough money to set aside some savings and open up a new business which will allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Cheikh ( qui tient la fiche sur la photo) est un homme marié.Il est père de trois enfants.Depuis son jeune âge, il voue à d'agriculteur une vraie passion.Période cette période,il accompagnait son père dans les champs et s'occupait de la chasse des oiseaux granivores.Aujourd'hui, il exploite les champs de son père après la mort de ce dernier.Il cultive du mil, de l'arachide, des haricots et du melon.Une partie de la production est destiné à la consommation alors qu'une autre est vendue sur les marchés locaux.Ceci lui permet d'obtenir des revenus afin de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Actuellement il sollicite un pret de 150 000fcfa pour acheter des semences et de l' engrais.Son ambition est de creuser un puits pour faire du maraîchage durant la contre saison.
texts.en: Cheikh (holding the application in the picture) is married and a father of 3. Ever since his childhood, when he would go hunting seed-eating birds in fields with his father, he has been passionate about farming. Since the man died, Cheikh has been working on his father's fields. He grows millet, peanuts, beans, and melons. Part of the production is for personal consumption, the rest is sold in local markets. This activity has enabled him to generate an income substantial enough to meet his family's needs, as well as his own. He is currently applying for a 150 000f CFA loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. His ambition is to dig a well for off-season truck farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eutimia

texts.en: Eutimia is 59 years old and the widowed mother of one child who lives in Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor. She earns a living by selling food, and earns about PHP 2,000 per month. Eutimia is requesting a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy ingredients which she will use to make food to sell. She is a new member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and in the future would like to earn enough money to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food-vending business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia operates a provision store near Kwarhinkrom in Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a businessman. Cecilia has been selling provisions for five years now. She is responsible for paying for her children’s school fees as her husband is in charge of other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for her store. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for her store

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio is married and has seven children. He is 58 years of age, and he lives in Canibungan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He raises bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers for his farm. Eugenio been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, he hopes to improve his business so that he can give a brighter future to his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for grazing his cows.

loans.name: Charisma

texts.en:
Charisma  is  30  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Charisma has a sari-sari, or food/retail shop, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Charisma has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Charisma hopes to improve her business to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
Ma. Tessie is 44 years old and lives in Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

Ma. Tessie has a pig-raising business and earns approximately PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more pigs to raise.

Ma. Tessie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to have a piggery in their barangay.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana, age 63, earns a living by selling gasoline in her local barangay. She and her husband live in South Poblacion, Siquijor, Siquijor, and have five adult-age children.
 
Emeliana has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PhP 5,000.00. She has requested a loan of PhP 3,000 to purchase gallons of gasoline to offer for sale.

Emeliana is a newly-recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. In the future, Emeliana hopes to build savings from the increased profit of her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of gasoline to offer for sale

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Crisanta is married and has nine children. To make a living, Crisanta owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Crisanta been engaged in business for six years and earns PHP 10,000 a month from these activities. 

Crisanta is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. In 2006, Crisanta joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and lives in Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is married with five children. To earn a living, Erlinda has a business selling food. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Erlinda has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to pay for labor, and to purchase nails, wood and other materials for house renovation. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to succeed in her business.

loans.use: To pay for labor, and to purchase nails, wood and other materials for house renovation.

location.town: Plaridel-Lower Puntod, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 49 years old and lives in Helen, Larena, Siquijor.  He is married with two children. Leonardo has a General Store business and earns approximately PHP 7,200 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for labor, and to purchase nails, cement, wood and other materials for house construction. Leonardo is a newly recognized member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative as he joined last May 29, 2012.  In the future, Leonardo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To pay for labor, and to purchase nails, cement, wood and other materials for house construction.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Wilfreda is married and has six children. To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a business venture, providing repair services to local community members. Wilfreda has been operating her business for 33 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Wilfreda is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. In 2010, Wilfreda joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
A married father of six children, Kao is aged 62, and living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. Out of his six children, he still has four (two daughters and two sons) children who are dependent to take care of. To support his family, he has been involved in cassava planting on two hectares, cashew on one hectare and rubber planting on four hectares of farmland. He has been in this business for ten years. The current business earns him approximately USD 11.00 per day and he is able to save about USD 4.00 each day. 

Kao is in his fourth cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He completely paid back the past loans, which have helped him relieve family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now he is applying for a loan of USD 1,500 with VisionFund. He will use this loan to buy rubber seedlings for his rubber plantation and use a portion of it to spend for labor and land plowing. With this loan, he hopes to make more income so as to build on some savings to fulfill his future dream of have a bigger house for living in.

loans.use: To buy rubber seedlings for his rubber plantation.

loans.name: Tureme Group

texts.fr:
Anitha fait partie du groupe  Tureme et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 23 ans et est mariée à  Elie, agent des services  aéronautiques.
Elle prend soin de 2 enfants qui étudient.

Elle vend les services de secrétariat public  depuis 3 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de matériaux de bureaux (fardes, papiers duplicateurs, enveloppes sac,...) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait avoir un grand capital.
texts.en:
Anitha lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the Tureme group. She is 23 years old and married to aeronautical service agent named Elie. She takes care of two children who both attend school.

She has been selling public secretarial services for three years now.

This is her third loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan that she is receiving, she will increase her capital and buy lots of office supplies (folders, ditto machines, catalog envelopes,...) to resell in order to earn more money.

In the coming years, she would like to have a large amount of capital.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy lots of office supplies (folders, ditto machines, catalog envelopes,...) intended for resale

loans.name: 05.05.21 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điệp, age 41, operates a food-stall restaurant, selling sweet rice. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for the food she prepares and sells. Điệp is the group leader of the 05.05.21 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her husband and their two children.

The main hardship that Điệp faces in her business is lack of capital. In 2009, Mrs. Điệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in order to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Điệp hopes to secure her children's educations, to ensure that her family is healthy and happy, and to help her business thrive.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for the sweet rice that she prepares and sells

loans.name: Clemencia Cecilia

texts.es: Clemencia ha solicitado su crédito para comprar respuestas de automotores, pernos, llaves, filtros y accesorios de carro ya que esto son los productos que oferta en su negocio. Lo empezaron juntos después que su esposo salió de la cooperativa de transporte de pasajeros en la cual trabaja, con la liquidación que recibió y algo de dinero que tenían ahorrado pusieron el negocio. Fue una buena alternativa ya que sabe de automotores y de repuestos, ahora está saliendo adelante a pesar de tener competencia. Clemencia se dedica más la atención al público y del trato con los proveedores, abre el negocio todos los días de lunes a sábado desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. El sueño de Clemencia a futuro es poder abrir un restaurant en el centro de Quevedo el cual está en marcha ya que quiere empezar un negocio nuevo e independiente del de su esposo.
texts.en:
Clemencia has requested a loan to purchase spare car parts, bolts, keys, filters, and car accessories because these are the products she offers in her store. She and her husband started it together after he left the passenger transportation cooperative at which he worked, and using the settlement he got and a bit of money they had saved they opened the business.

It was a good option since he knows about cars and spare parts. Now it's doing well despite competition. Clemencia focuses more of her attention on the public and dealing with suppliers. She opens the store every day Monday through Saturday from 8 in the morning until 6 at night.

Clemencia's dream for the future is to be able to open a restaurant in downtown Quevedo. This is underway because she wants to start a new business that's independent of her husband's.

loans.use: to buy bolts, keys, filters and car accessories.

loans.name: Bebialen

texts.en:
Bebialen, age 24, prepares and sells barbecue to earn a living. She lives with her husband and child in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City.

Bebialen used her last loan to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make the barbecue food she sells. Her business has thrived and become more successful as a result. 

She is now taking out a new loan in order to purchase raw ingredients for barbecue and to purchase kitchen utensils needed for food preparation. She is confident that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for barbecue and to purchase kitchen utensils needed for food preparation

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 34 years old and lives in Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.  She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Liezel operates a general store and earns about PHP 10,000.00 each month.  Liezel has requested a loan of 30000 to purchase more stock for her store.

Liezel is a new member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Coopeartive.  In the future, Liezel would like to see her business become more successful and save some money.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be would like to take another loan to buy more materials to increase her production of doors and windows. 

Be's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales.  She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more materials to increase her production of doors and windows.

loans.name: Doi

texts.en:
Doi is requesting a new loan to buy new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. 

This purchase will help him meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. 

He hopes that him new loan will help him in increase the size of his store and increase sales, and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. 

This purchase will help her meet the needs of her customers.  

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.  She hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her store, boost sales and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico, 37, is married with two children and lives in Lambojon, Siquijor, Siquijor.  

Rico sells spare parts for motors to earn a living and has had this business for one year.  Each month, he earns PHP 8,000.   

He has requested a loan of 30000 to purchase more spare parts to sell.

Rico has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  In the future, Rico hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her store, increase sales, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Carmen Cira

texts.es: Carmen de 50 años de edad vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil donde vende ropa y zapatos. Tiene varios años dedicándose a este negocio por lo que conoce la forma de trabajar, trabaja todos los días recorriendo diversos sectores y entregando a los clientes que le hacen pedidos. A su edad se siente con muy buena salud e indica que tiene para muchos años en adelante. En lo personal Carmen se encuentra separa de su esposo y sus hijos son personas mayores quienes han formado su propia familia. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de ropa y zapatos para tener de inventario y poder ofrecer variedad. Su mayor sueño es abrir una boutique para no tener que salir a recorrer.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old and lives in El Suburbio of Guayaquil where she sells clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for a number of years, so she knows the work. She works every day visiting different areas and delivering to clients that have placed orders.

She feels very healthy for her age and notes that she has many such years ahead of her. In her personal life, Carmen finds herself separated from her husband and her children are grown up and have started their own families.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase clothing and shoes to have inventory and be able to offer variety. Her greatest dream is to open a boutique so she won't have to go out and about.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: 3.14.171.thieu Khanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, age 34, earns a living by raising poultry and cattle. She and her husband have three children and live in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 3.14.171.Thieu Khanh solidarity group, which consists of six members. Mrs. Lan works hard to support her children with her business, which she has run for five years.

One of Mrs. Lan's most critical business difficulties is lack of capital. This will be her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase chicks to raise and sell.

With her business profit, Mrs. Lan intends to ensure that her business continues to do well. She also hopes eventually to buy land of her own. Her primary goal is to make enough money to continue to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Mop

texts.en:
Mop is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes her new loan will increase the size of her store, increase sales and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has four children. She is 42 years old, and resides in Tabid, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

She used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  Her business is successful.

Alma's taking a new loan to pay the cost of labor maintain her farm. In the future she hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor maintain her farm.

loans.name: Boeurn

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in Battambang province's Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Boeurn is 54 years old and a married father of three children, two (one daughter and one son) are dependents and in school. 

Boeurn earns a living by planting rice and its is his family's main source of income.  He has been in this business for twenty years, earning about KHR12,600 per day.  He manages to save about $3.50 each day. 

Boeurn is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  He is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for his family and also use a portion of it to buy fertilizer for his farmland and vegetables to start up a new business. 

He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s income and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his family and also use a portion of it to buy fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is a 57-year-old married woman.  She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For twenty years, she and her husband have run a barber shop to serve people in their community.

Long would like a loan to purchase better quality equipments and hair care products.  She hopes this will enable her to meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that her loan will increase her income.  Long wants to save money for any future difficulties that may face her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality equipments and hair care products.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, age 36, runs a sari-sari (general store) business. She has been engaged in her business for about ten years and lives in Tagbilaran, Bohol. In her store, Emelia sells such items as canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, and snack foods to the people in her community. It is a good business and provides her with the income that she needs. However, Emelia lacks the capital to make needed improvements to her business.

Emelia is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PhP, which will be used to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store. She is confident that if she is provided financial support through loans, she can realize her plans for expanding her business and increasing her profit.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, rice, noodles, soda, and snack foods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len is 59 years old and married with four children – three single children and one married child. She works hard in the rice field to satisfy their living needs and provide education to her children. She particularly grows rice on around two-hectares of  farmland, located in Ornlong Veng district, Oddar Meanchey province. Len has full support from her helpful husband in the business so they are able to ensure healthy crops and earn a good income each cropping season.

In this coming rainfall Len, and other farmers, are very busy with their farm work. In order to manage the process and make her business more productive, Len decided to borrow some funds in the sums of USD 1,000 to purchase farm supplies such as chemical fertilizers, pesticides and spare parts to maintain her plowing machine. This loan will enable Len to better her yields and income in the following harvesting season. Through her hard work and perseverance, she hopes to work her way up to be a successful entrepreneur and pursue a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and spare parts to maintain her plowing machine.

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc is 45 years old and is married. He has three children and lives with them and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City.

He and his wife have run a food stall at their house for five years. He sells breads, noodles and soup and he intends to use his loan to buy better quality food and ingredients to make many kinds of dishes to sell for his customers.

He hopes his business will run smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and to save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy better quality food and ingredients to make many kinds of dishes to sell for his customers.

loans.name: Leandina

texts.es:
Leandina tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la linda ciudad de chincha, la cual se caracteriza por ser la cual de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y por tener la mayor población de origen afroperuano de nuestro país, esta ciudad también es muy conocida por el don que tienen sus pobladores para la ´preparación de platillos riquísimos y también por su alegría y generosidad. Leandina en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho ver televisión y también le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favorito el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Actualmente Leandina se encuentra estudiando la carrera de gastronomía y lo hace con muchas ganas.

Con mucho entusiasmo Leandina trabaja como obrera en una empresa de transporte, ella lleva trabajando desde hace 4 años en la empresa ya que desde muy joven, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y con el fruto de su trabajo ella puede solventar los gastos de sus estudios; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y trabajadora.

Leandina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han enviado ella podrá comprar materiales para sus estudios de gastronomía como batidora, piretes, licuadora, mandiles, gorros, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener los implementos adecuados para sus clases y seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera, Tener su propio  restaurante y poder apoyar a su madre”.
texts.en:
Leandina is 20 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Chincha, which is known as the birthplace of some of Peru’s sports greats and for having the largest population of Afro-Peruvian origin in our country. This city is also very well known for the talent its inhabitants show in preparing delicious dishes and also for their geniality and generosity. In her free time, Leandina likes to watch television and she also enjoys one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Carapulcra con sopa seca” [a potato based chicken stew]. Currently, Leandina is studying for a degree in cooking and she does so enthusiastically.

She is also an enthusiastic worker in a transport business, where she has been employed for four years because she started when she was very young. She works around 10 hours a day and with the fruit of her labor she is able to play the costs of her studies. She believes that she is doing well at her job because she is very hardworking and responsible.

Leandina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have provided her, she will will be able to purchase materials for her cooking studies such as mixers, caps, aprons, blenders and other items. Thus she will be able to have the necessary equipment for her classes and continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: Finishing her studies and owning her own restaurant and being able to help her mother.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as a mixer, caps, a blender, aprons and other items.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 24 years, is single and lives with his family.

Since 2010, Ahmad has owned a food market where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, snacks, detergents and other products. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy an air conditioner and install an external ceiling for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase profits to be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a air conditioner and install an external ceiling for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 36 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. He is single.

To earn a living, Jelly has a Sari Sari store business. He earns about PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of work.  Jelly has requested a loan of PHP 15000 to purchase more stock for his existing business.

Jelly has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  In the future, Jelly would like to have more savings deposited from the profit of his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his grocery store.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is from Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Arturo is married and has 4 children. 

To make a living, Arturo owns and operates a business making and serving a variety of different snack items. Arturo been in business for 4 years and earns 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Arturo joined GDMPC. Arturo is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: 3.14.173.thieu Khanh Group

texts.en:
Thúy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thúy is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thúy supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province The other child is grown up.

Thúy is the group leader of the 3.14.173.Thieu Khanh solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, age 57 and widowed, owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products to earn a living. She lives in Sinusa, Ozamis City, and has one child. Gloria has been engaged in her business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PhP 6,000.00. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 8,500.00 in order to purchase new items to offer in her shop, allowing her to expand her product offering. Gloria joined GDMPC in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services, which helped to improve her business and her living situation. 

In the future, Gloria wants to build a house and to see her child attain a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase new items to offer in her shop, allowing her to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta de 57 años es una costurera con varios años de experiencia, lo que la hace una profesional. Vive en la zona conocida como Isla Trinitaria, comenta que toda la vida a vivido ahí y no piensa cambiarse a pesar de que se ha vuelto peligroso ya que tiene su clientela en esta parte del sector. Empezó hace 20 años ya que siempre le gusto la confección de ropa y con esta actividad podía cuidar de sus hijos sin ningún tipo de problemas. Realizo varios cursos para conocer las técnicas y con un dinero ahorrado compro una máquina de coser la cual es la misma que la acompaña hasta hoy en día. La confección la realiza sola, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga que entregar si es mucho contrata a una amiga pagándole por horas. Jacinta tiene 7 hijos pero todos son mayores de edad e independiente, vive únicamente junto a su esposo quien labora en una empresa privada. Con el crédito que está solicitando va a comprar telas, botones, cierres, encajes, cintas e hilos. Su mayor sueño es poder comprar maquinas industriales y abrir un taller en su domicilio con personas a su cargo.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 57 years old and is a seamstress with many years of experience, which makes her a professional. She lives in an area known as Isla Trinitaria, and says that she's lived there her whole life. She isn't thinking of moving, despite the fact that it has become dangerous, because her clientele is in that part of the city.

She started 20 years ago since she always liked making clothes, and with this activity she could take care of her children without any sort of problem. She took various classes to get to know the techniques, and with some savings she bought a sewing machine which is the same one she uses to this day.

She does the fabrication by herself, depending on the amount of work she has to do. If it's a lot she contracts a friend, paying her by the hour.

Jacinta has 7 children but they are all grown up and independent. She lives only with her husband, who works at a private company.

With the credit she is requesting, she is going to purchase fabric, buttons, zippers, lace, ribbon and thread. Her greatest dream is to be able to buy industrial machines and open a workshop in her home with people working for her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, zippers, lace, ribbon and thread.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, continua con sus planes hacia un futuro, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda y darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, doña juana trabaja duro para poder ayudar en gastos del hogar, con este nuevo credito construira parate de su casa y comprara los siguientes materiales: Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Hierro, Estrivos, Tablas. para y su esposo se les ha hecho dificil recoger de una sola vez el dinero para comprar estos materiales, pero gracias a Afodenic van a poder cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Juana lives in Ticuantepe.  She continues with her plans for the future.  She wants to improve her home and give her children better living conditions.  Juana works hard to be able to help with the household expenses.

With this new loan she will build part of her house.  She will buy the following materials:  concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, supports, and boards.  It has been difficult for her and her husband to get together all at once the money to buy those materials.  Thanks to Afodenic they are going to be able to fulfill their dream.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel, iron, supports, and boards.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 31, is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has two children aged 5 and 6. She buys bananas from farmers and sells the produce in the market for a profit. Her business started a year ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more bananas for resale. This way, she can buy in bulk and maximize her profits for the sake of her children. In the future, she wants to have other business options and hopes to see her children finish their education. Most of her income goes toward her children's needs like food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: 3.14.172.thieu Khanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến, age 33, raises poultry and cattle to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband live in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with their one child. She is the group leader of the 3.14.172.Thieu Khanh solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan in order to buy chicks to raise and sell. This is Yến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Yến hopes to buy land of her own, to ensure that her children do well in school, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh, age 41, runs a general store business in front of her home. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She and her husband have one son and one daughter and live in Ho Chi Minh City. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children.
 
Linh is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by buying more household items and a variety of of soft drinks to stock in her store. She is confident that this will enable her to attract more customers and to increase business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business for the future.

loans.use: to buy household items and a variety of soft drinks to stock in her store

loans.name: Jose Isan

texts.es: El Sr. Jose  Isan  de 36 años, casado y con 1 hijo, cuenta con una antigüedad de más de 9 meses  dedicándose a los trabajos de construcción, en lo cual ya cuenta con una experiencia de más de 8 años, ya que su  papa se dedicaba a lo mismo. Con esfuerzo a sacado a su familia adelante cuenta con casa propia, y tiene pensado ir ampliando, para dejarles  un buen patrimonio a su familia. El Sr. Jose Isan solicita crédito para iniciar a construir su barda y que su familia este  más segura y tranquila cuando él no se encuentre en su casa.
texts.en: Sr. Jose Isan, 36, married and with one child, has spent more than nine months devoted to construction work, an area where he has already had more than eight years of experience because his father did the same work. He has moved his family forward with effort and has his own house which he is going to expand so that he can leave a good legacy to his family. Jose Isan is requesting a loan in order to start constructing his perimeter wall, so that his family will be safer and feel more secure when he is not at home.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: La señora Placida, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en la comunidad de Azacualpa, Intibucá. Ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a cultivar papas, brócoli, coliflor y repollo. Además compra y vende hortalizas, todos estos productos los vende en el mercado municipal. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000.00 Lempiras para darle un buen mantenimiento y asistencia a los cultivos de brócoli y coliflor, ya que si no es así es difícil mantener los cultivos y sacar buena cosecha. Su meta es aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida. Pertenece al G.S. Nueva Esperanza, que está formado por seis miembros, residen en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura, en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda está la señora Placida de vestido azul, luego sigue María Félix, María Adelayda, María Francisca y María Paulina a la derecha. solamente cinco solicitan préstamo en este ciclo. El préstamo grupal es por 21,000.00 Lempiras.
texts.en:
Placida, age 44, is married and has four children.  She lives in the Azacualpa community in Intibucá.  She has been growing potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, and cabbage for 20 years.  She also buys and sells vegetables, and she sells all of these products at the municipal market.

She is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras in order to provide good maintenance and assistance to the crops and to have a good harvest.  Her goal is to increase sales and her income in order to have a better quality of life.

She belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza” [New Hope] communal bank, which is comprised of six members.  They live in the same community, and they are farmers.  

In the photo Placida is to the left wearing a blue dress, then María Félix, María Adelayda, María Francisca, and María Paulina is to the right.

There are only five that are requesting a loan in this cycle.  The group loan is for 21,000 lempiras.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor for the broccoli and cauliflower crops.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old and married with three children. She has been running a dairy farming business for 9 years, earning a monthly income of KES 69,000.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to purchase another dairy cow. She plans to plow back the anticipated profit into the business.

She hopes to grow her business and give her children better education in the future.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Rossy

texts.en: Rossy is a 54-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 21 years to 30 years. She describes herself as influential and social. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located at a very competitive area and her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest business challenge is transportation in delivering milk to customers. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern. Her business goal is to run a dairy company within the next five years. She hopes that in the future she will have improved her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern.

loans.name: 3.14.175.thieu Khanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh, age 29, operates a small refreshment bar where she sells beverages such as coffee, tea, and soft drinks, as well as snack foods. She has been engaged in this business for two years. She lives with her husband in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 3.14.175.Thieu Khanh solidarity group, which consists of six members.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. Mrs. Than is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials to replenish her refreshment bar. This will be her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
 
With her business profit, Mrs. Thanh plans to keep her family healthy and happy, to eventually buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to replenish her refreshment bar with such items as coffee, tea, soft drinks, and snack foods

loans.name: Gladys Obdulia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes como arroz,azucar,leche,fideos y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,fideos,harinas y aceites al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with her grocery story business such as rice, sugar, milk, pasta and oil.  She works from 8 am until 10 pm with this business.  She wants to get ahead with her dream and to enlarge the grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, pasta, flour and oil wholesale.


She is happy with the loan and promises to make the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, flour and oil wholesale

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
This is Cristita, 45, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Francisco and she is a mother to her six children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Cristita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory, and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Cristita hopes her business would expand and that her children will have a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is from Poblacion, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Jonathan is married and has one child.

To make a living, Jonathan works in someone else's business providing motor transport services. Jonathan has been in his business for 3 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jonathan joined GDMPC. Jonathan is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: 3.14.176.thieu Khanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan is working in agriculture. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell in the future. 

Loan is 55 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 3.14.176.Thieu Khanh solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

Loan supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, as her children are grown up.

This is Loan's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Loan hopes for her children to find good jobs, to buy land of her own and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell in the future

loans.name: 3.14.177.thieu Khanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gái, age 61, raises poultry and cattle to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years. She and her husband live in  a rural town in Thanh Hoa province and have three grown children. 

Gái is the group leader of the 3.14.177.Thieu Khanh solidarity group, which consists of five members. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan in order to buy chicks to raise and sell. This is Gái's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Gái hopes to help her children find a good job, to eventually buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: La socia Agueda nació en la provincia de Chumbivilca pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a la venta de pasamanería de forma ambulatorio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar betunes, pilas,  botones, agujas y otras cosas más. Ya son 18 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member, Agueda, was born in the province of Chumbivilca, but lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She is 35 years old and lives in a common law relationship from which she has two children. She belongs to “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” Communal Bank and it is going very well, thanks to her prompt re-payments of her loans. 

Agueda is a street vender who sells notions. Currently she needs a loan to purchase shoe polish, batteries, buttons, needles and other items. She has been engaged in this business for 18 years and it is going very well. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time, according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase shoe polish, batteries, buttons, needles and other items.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with 3 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Gina owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns 6,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals.

Gina has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2009. In the future, Gina hopes to augment her business someday.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: La socia Melania nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad La socia Melania requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, chompas, polos, camisas, vestidos y otras cosas más. La  socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Melania was born in Cusco province and lives in the city in which she was born.  She is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have two children.  Melania belongs to “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” community bank and is doing very well as she makes her repayments punctually.  Her business is selling clothing.  She has been in this business for a number of years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, Melania needs a loan to buy clothing such as pants, sweaters, tops, shirts, dresses, etc.  She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, sweaters, tops, shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe David

texts.es: El Sr. Guadalupe David de 46 años de edad es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun dependen económicamente de él. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y artículos usados mientras que Guadalupe tiene un pequeño negocio denominado “BOTER” en el cual se encarga de distribuir tapas y botellas para agua purificada. El quiere brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y sabe que lo puede lograr haciendo que su negocio crezca ya que esto representara un aumento en su economía y podrá enviar a sus hijos a escuelas de mejor calidad. Es por eso que el pide nuestra ayuda para invertir en su negocio, expandirlo y darse a conocer.
texts.en: Guadalupe David is 46 years old, married, and has three children who are still financially dependent on him.  His wife sells used clothing and second-hand goods while Guadalupe has a small business called 'BOTER' which sells bottles and bottle caps for purified water.  He would like to offer his children a better future and knows that he can achieve this by growing his business as this will mean an increase in his finances and he will be able to send his children to better quality schools.  He is requesting our help so that he can invest in his business, expand it and become well known.

loans.use: to invest in his business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru: Людмила замужем, дети уже взрослые. Торгует на рынке косметикой. Имеет два торговых места с хорошей проходимостью.  Просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку летнего товара – дезодорантов, кремов для загара, увлажняющих кремов и т.п. Людмила планиует открыть еще одно торговое место. Это позволит ей получать больше прибыли и улучшать свои жилищные условия. Людмила – трудолюбивый и честный человек. Она вовремя выплачивает кредиты и не имеет опозданий.
texts.en: Liudmila is married, and her children are grown now. She sells cosmetics at the market. She has two retail locations in high traffic areas. She would like a loan to buy summer products — deodorants, sunblock creams, moisterizers, etc. Liudmila plans to open one more retail location. This will help her increase profits and improve her living conditions. Liudmila is a hardworking and honest person. She pays off her loans on time and never makes a late payment.

loans.use: to buy summer products: deodorants, creams, etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel  de 61 años de edad es pensionado pero eso no lo ha detenido para salir adelante por el y por su esposa ya que sus hijos son casados y no viven con él. Manuel está trabajando como auxiliar en la presidencia municipal desde Enero del 2010. Las temperaturas de nuestra ciudad son muy extremas tanto en tiempo de calor como en tiempo de frio es por eso que  está solicitando nuestra ayuda para terminar de construir un cuarto en la parte posterior de su casa el cual está hecho de cartón él quiere mejorar su condición de vida, para tener un mejor patrimonio que ofrecerle a su esposa.
texts.en:
Manuel is 61 and a pensioner. But that hasn't stopped him from moving forward, both for his own sake and that of his wife, as their children are married and don't live with them.

Manuel has been working as an assistant at the town hall since January, 2010. 

Our city's temperatures are very extreme, both in the hot season and in the cold season. That is why he is requesting our help to finish building a room in the back part of his house, a room which is now made of cardboard. 

He wants to improve his living conditions, in order to have a better legacy to offer his wife.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Oscar Yovany

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltero, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Morazan, Yoro, junto a un hermano menor.
Hace 2 años que Oscar se dedica al cultivo de café, y desde antes cultiva también maíz y frijoles. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Solicita un préstamo por 3,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante para el cultivo de café, que es el cultivo más fuerte que tiene, y comprara el fertilizante de buena calidad que le ayude a sacar buena producción. Su meta es crecer con su finca con la ayuda de Dios y con el financiamiento de ODEF y de KIVA. El pertenece al grupo solidario Gran bendición, que está formado por tres miembros.
texts.en:
Oscar is 26 years old and single.  He lives with his younger brother in a village in the Morazan municipality in Yoro.

Oscar has been growing coffee for two years.  He has also been growing corn and beans for a longer amount of time.  He sells the production at the local market.

He is requesting a loan for 3,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop, which is the strongest crop he has.  He will buy good quality fertilizer to help him get good production.

His goal is to grow with his farm with help from God and the loan from ODEF and Kiva.  He belongs to the “Gran Bendición” [Great Blessing] communal bank, which is comprised of three members.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintenance of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: El socio Saturnino nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 65 años de edad y es viuda pero tiene 8 hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la refaccionar de zapatos y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Saturnino requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo suela, hilos, cola y otras cosas más.  El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower, Saturnino, was born in Cusco province, and lives in the same city where he was born. He is 65 and a widower, but has eight children. He belongs to the “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” communal bank, and it is going very well, because he is making his installment payments on time.
 
He repairs shoes, and has a small workshop in his home. He has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well. 

On this occasion, Saturnino needs the loan to buy work materials such as shoe soles, thread, glue and other items. He is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay his installments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy work materials such as shoe soles, thread, glue and other items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: El socio Samuel nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 44 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la confección de zapatos y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Samuel requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cuero, hilos, pegamento y otras cosas más.  El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower, Samuel, was born in Cusco province, and lives in the same city where he was born. He is 44, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He belongs to the “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” communal bank, and it is going very well, because he is making his installment payments on time.

He makes shoes, and has a small workshop in his home. He has been working in this business for several years now, and it is going very well.

On this occasion, Samuel needs the loan to buy work materials such as leather, thread, glue and other items. He is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay his installments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy work materials such a leather, thread, glue and other items.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de pension familiar,el socio junto con su esposa preparan desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
