This member continues working in his family restaurant.  He and his wife prepare breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  He works form 8.00am to 5.00pm and, through his business, he hopes to make progress in life.  He is requesting this loan to buy cooking supplies such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables.

The member is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios, a widow, is 69 years old and lives in Cabungaan, Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Remedios owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 10,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 45,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Remedios has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2007. In the future, Remedios's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a transport service used in business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children. 

Anecita has a small store that sells fruit and firewood. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fruit and firewood to resell.

Anecita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and firewoods to resell.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is a single mother of two children.  She is 40 years old and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor.

Medelyn sells ready-to-wear products to earn a living.  She has had this business for two years.  Each month, she earns at least PHP 15,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase a new set of ready-to-wear products to sell.

Medelyn was newly recognized as a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative on June 18, 2012.  Medelyn would like to establish strong and progressive marketing in her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new set of ready-to-wear products to sell.

loans.name: Nesa

texts.en:
Nesa is 40 years old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married, with six children. Her eldest is 19, and her youngest is 1 year old. Her husband works as a welder. 

Nesa help her family by operating a small sari-sari store, a convenience store, within her house. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, noodles, items in sachet like coffee, creamers, canned goods, toiletries, and seasonings. 

With additional capital, Nesa will be able to increase her inventory and offer her customers the basic household commodities. Her profit will be used for her children's nutritious diet and their school fees.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, coffee, canned goods, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 58 years old and married, with one child.  She lives in Poblacion, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.

Marilyn has a little general store and a Videoke system business.  She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more stock for her store and to repair her Videoke entertainment system. 

Marilyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months.  In the future, Marilyn hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store and to repair her Videoke entertainment system.

loans.name: Vian Jhon

texts.en: Vian Jhon used his last loan to register his motorcycle. He successfully registered the motorcycle, so he is taking out a new loan to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. In the future, he hopes to have additional income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Alejandrina, tiene 59 años de edad está casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una aldea cercana a santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.
La señora tiene más de 10 años que estableció su propia fuente de ingresos, vende productos de consumo diario como ser: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, harina, productos lácteos, condimentos y todo tipo de abarrotería. ha mantenido estable este pequeño negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, el que solicita actualmente es el quinto préstamo y es por 20,000 lempiras, con este préstamo ella quiere surtir mas la pulpería para mantener siempre productos que demandan los clientes, todo tipo de productos alimenticios de consumo diario. Ella desea mantener siempre activo este negocio y bien surtido para vender más.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, age 59, is married and has four children.  She lives with her husband and their four children in a village near Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.

She established her own source of income over ten years ago.  She sells daily consumption products like beans, sugar, flour, dairy products, condiments, and all types of grocery items.  She has kept this small business stable through the investment of several loans.

The loan she is currently requesting is her fifth loan, and it is for 20,000 lempiras.  With this loan she wants to stock her grocery store more in order to always meet her customer demand.  This means all types of daily consumption food products.  She wishes to always keep this business active and well-stocked in order to sell more.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store business with basic needs products.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, who is 57 years old and a resident of Cavite City, Philippines.  She is married to Antonio.  Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business.  She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  

Juanita operates a tailoring business. She specifically offers curtains. There are seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Aside from this, she sells dried fish for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juanita hopes to have an alternative business through all her hard work on her business . She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of cloth, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: 3.14.178.thieu Khanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngụ  is involved in the farming of poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 64 years old and married with four children.

Ngụ is the group leader of the 3.14.178.Thieu Khanh solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Her children are grown up and she has no dependents to support with her business, which is located in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ngụ  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Ngụ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With the business profit, she wants to remodel her house, buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and also help her children find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn is a 37-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia.  She and her husband don't have any children yet, but they wish to have one soon. 

Horn is a farmer who owns and manages a few hectares of farm land primarily for growing rice. while her husband works as a local construction laborer around the province. 

Horn has been farming for more than 20 years. She learned these skills and her farming practices from her parents.

Horn wants to renovate her present house to repair very bad rain damage. She would like to acquire a loan from Kiva lenders in order to have her house rebuilt. She will purchase the construction supplies needed, such as wallboard and tiles. Her husband and his team will be in charge of performing the construction. 

Horn hopes to have a suitable house for living. She is very thankful, and she will pay her loan back in full.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Yermi

texts.en:
Yemri is a 46-year-old father of six children: Ivon, Nova, Stivany, Ani, Sani and Pangeran. They range in age from 3 to 24 years old. Yemri and his wife Yohana, who is 45, run a food-stall business to support their family. 

Prior to running the business, Yemri and his wife were working as chefs at a private company.  They then decided to quit that job and establish their own business. By using their savings, Yemri and Yohana were able to build up a simple stall to start with. They provide various menus to serve their customers, and the business runs well. 

Yemri is quite pleased with the progress of his business, but he would like to improve the food stall layout to attract customers and make them feel more comfortable when visiting his food stall.  Therefore he is requesting loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to implement his plan.

loans.use: to improve the food stall layout

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old widow, Orn lives with her three children in a rural area of the Krokor district of Pursat province.  She earns a living and feeds her small children by farming rice and running a grocery store in the front of her house. She has been in the business for four years. 

This is group loan for Orn’s group of four female members.  All of them have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles. Orn has successfully used past loans to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Now she can earn about KHR 26,000 per day. 

After the successful loans with VisionFund, she is now leading her group to apply for another loan to support their respective businesses. Orn, who is the leader, will use her portion to purchase fertilizers for her rice field and more grocery items for her store. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy two piglets as another business. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income, so as to set aside some money to afford a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her rice field and stock for her store.

loans.name: Zarragul

texts.en: Zarragul is a woman who always searches for new ways to make money. She is very young but has had a very difficult life. She is a divorcee, and she is raising her 3 smart children alone. Zarragul has many friends, but they can’t help her improve her living conditions. Her parents are old, and they also can’t help her. She is going to create her own business that sells curtains for home use. She has enough business skills, and she will be the best business woman. She will use her profits to enter her children into good schools.  She is asking for a loan to buy different kinds of curtains for her retail business. Her business will be situated in the local market. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of curtains for her retail business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, who is 46 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Daniel, and they has seven children.   She manages her household while operating a business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  

Luzviminda operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy household items from her contact companies and resell them for a profit. Her products are rice cookers, stoves, electric fans, and more. Customers are attracted to buy by her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of used items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luzviminda dreams that her business would grow and be able to give support her children in their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of household items needed in her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Saranak's Group

texts.en: Saranak is a 43-year-old resident from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is married and has two dependent children who are still in school. She earns an income for her family's sake. She receives a minimal salary as a teacher at a local public school. Additionally, she also sells sweet potatoes for extra income. She has been in this business for 15 years and is able to earn about 57,000 KHR per day. Saranak has had 3 previous loans with VisionFund and has completely repaid them. The past three loans have helped her to well-manage her business and maintain a standard of living for her family. She has now formed a group of four to request a new loan. Saranak and two other members are applying for 1,400,000 KHR, while another member is seeking a loan for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy more sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en: Narin is a resident from the Sangke district of Battambang province. She is a 42-year-old mother of six kids. Five out of her six children are living with her and assisting in the family's business, which is selling gasoline. Narin has been in this business for three years to support her household. Narin and her group member have been with VisionFund for 6 loans and have completely repaid them. The past 6 loans have helped her to pay for her family's daily needs. Now, she and her group member are seeking a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR for each of them. She, as the group leader, will use her loan's portion to buy gasoline to sell. She hopes to earn more income and expand her business gradually.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to sell

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom lives in a wooden house in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district. She is 43 years old and married. She has five children. Only one of them is still in school, while two of them are working in Thailand, and the rest work at the family’s business. The primary source of her family’s income is from rice farming, which she and her husband have been doing for twenty years. They supplement their family’s income by milling rice for a fee. The main challenge for her family’s business is the lack of water to grow her rice. Now, she can earn a daily income of about 63,000 KHR. 

This is the first loan for Rom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR with VisionFun in order to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ram

texts.en:
Thirty year-old Ram is a married man with two children, aged 9 and 11 years. He lives in Bien Unido, Bohol, and is involved in fishing. He also grows seaweed to sell.

Ram works hard to provide for his family's basic needs and to send his children to school. He has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, seaweed seedlings and gasoline. Ram hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, seaweed seedlings and gasoline

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally is 49 years old and a mother of 6 kids, five of whom are her dependents, as they are still at school. To endure the family's hardships, she has been growing paddy rice on one hectare of land and supplements the income by working for others for a fee. Currently, she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current businesses that she has been with for 20 years. Her main challenge is the drought, which makes her crop yield fruitless.

Phally's group consists of three female members. She and one other member are the newly joined clients, while the remaining is a client in her second cycle. They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each and Phally, the group leader, is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her rice field. She hopes to earn more income so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her rice field

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun is 52 years old.  She is married and has six children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for twenty-five years, while her husband makes palm sugar to generate more income for the family. The main challenge for her family’s business is the low crop yields. 

Phoeun has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and she successfully paid back the loans, which has enabled her to relieve the family’s burden and to buy a plot of farmland. Now she can earn about 24,800KHR per day to feed her family. She is leading the other two members who have been with VisionFund from one to three cycles. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy a piglet as another business. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: El señor José aparte de ser padre de familia es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor que siempre está al pendiente de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su esposa la señora concepción que junto con el manejan una tiendita de abarrotes desde hace aproximadamente 3 años y es un buen ingreso extra a su domicilio, el señor José trabaja en una fábrica de la localidad y así puede mantener los gastos diarios de su familia. El crédito lo solicita para compra de mercancía así podrá surtir mas su tienda y podrá tener más venta incrementar sus ganancias y el numero de sus clientes. Agradecerá la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: Besides being a father, José is a hardworking and enterprising man that is always responsive to the needs of his children and his wife, Concepción.  Together with her, they have managed a small general store for approximately three years.  It brings in good extra income to their household.  José works in a local factory and this way is able to provide for the daily expenses of his family.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase merchandise to stock his store so that he will be able to increase sales and profit as well as the number of customers.  He will be grateful for any help provided.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a house with a thatched roof in a rural village of Pursat province’s Bakan district, Thy is a 39-year-old mother of six children.  Four of them are still in school while the other two are paid workers. The source of the family’s income is mainly from rice farming, which she and her husband have been in for several years. 

This is the first microloan for Thy’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Now leading her group of five to apply for a loan, Thy will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a seamstress.  She sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and has a great passion for her profession. Her work is liked by her clients and they give her regular orders every month.  Her husband is a butcher by profession and sells meat. Kosar has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son stitches jackets while her second son is studying.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who is also a butcher and wants to buy animals for his business.
Kosar is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for him and will increase his income.

loans.use: To buy animals for meat business

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area in Pursat province’s Krokor district, Kav is 44 years old and married. She has six children, two of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been raising pigs for 12 years, and sometimes she and her husband work for others to generate extra income. The current business earns her about 8,300KHR per day to feed the family. 

This is Kav’s group, with two members. Kav completely repaid her first loan with VisionFund and the first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she and her other group member, who is new to VisionFund this loan cycle, are applying for a loan of 100,000KHR and 200,000KHR, respectively. As the leader, Kav is going to use her portion to buy feed for her pigs. She hopes to feed her pigs so they will be fat and healthy and also hopes to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Alejandro, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, nuestro socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de expendio de alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, por ello invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, y bebidas entre otros productos.
Alejandro está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our associate is Alejandro.  He belongs to the community bank "Los Lideres" (The Leaders) of the city of Cusco, Peru.  He continues to work at his business selling basic foods in his general store.  For this reason, he will invest the loan in buying products like rice, sugar, milk, and drinks, amongst other products.

Alejandro is very grateful to KIVA for allowing him to continue with his activity and for supporting him and his family.  He is thankful for the loan and promises to make his payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and drinks.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 51 years old and lives in Bolot, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She is married with six children. To earn a living, Norma has a business selling snacks in the market. She earns about 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. Norma requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase assorted ingredients like flour, milk and sugar for her business.

Norma has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative since May 18, 2012. In the future, Norma has high hopes that her profit will pay for the tuition fees of her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase assorted ingredients like flour, milk and sugar for a snacks business

loans.name: Hort's Group

texts.en:
Ek Phnom is the residential area for Hort as well as her family of six children. Two of her children are staying with her and helping the family's business. To feed the entire household, she has been planting watermelons and corn as her main business. Additionally, her husband helps in increasing income by growing paddy rice, raising cows and fishing. Hort has been in this business for 35 years and can earn about 47,500 KHR (Khmer Riel, Cambodia's local currency). Last year's flood and the drought from the first quarter of this year have been the main challenges for her, causing her crop yield to decline. 

Hort has joined VisionFund five times already. The previous loans, which she completely paid back, have enabled her to stabilize her standard of living. Now she is leading a group of three to request a new loan. She and one of her group members are each seeking 1,400,000 KHR while the remaining group member is applying for 400,000 KHR. To boost her crop yield, Hort is going to use her loan’s portion to buy seeds, fertilizers, and gasoline for water pumping. She expects to increase her cash-crop so she can earn more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for water pumping

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is age 53 and a diligent mother of three children.  She lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Since she was a teenaged girl, Chan has helped her parents in the farming business, and she has been doing it as the major source of her family’s income ever since. Chan was married to a local farmer, but in the past few years her spouse has passed away. However, she still has a strong determination to work out her plan and supply basic necessities to her children, especially education.

As of now, she is seeking a loan of USD 500 to supplement her existing capital, which will be used to purchase bean seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay labor costs. This will be her first loan through HKL. She hopes that she will be able to grow an abundant harvest in the coming seasons with the help of the loan. She aspires to save money for the future growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Savoeun is 27 years old and married. She is a mother of two. One daughter is still dependent on her and in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been rice farming for four years. Together, they can earn about KHR25,600 to meet the family’s need.

Savoeun’s group consists of three members who live in the same village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is the only lady in the group. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other members are first-time borrowers. She has used the past loans to better support her rice business. 

Now leading her group to request a loan, Savoeun will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and will use a part of it for plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is 25 years old and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, with her dad and brother. Since last year she has been employed as a vendor in the supermarket.  Her dad is retired; her brother works as a fireman in the airport. 

They own an old house that was built a long time ago.  It has never had an overhaul since it was built.  In winter, her old house loses heat, and smoke from heating escapes, through the roof and walls.  She and her brother together made a small repair, but still it is happening. So she wants to have professional builders make the repairs before this coming winter. 

For many years, her family has burned too much coal and other kind of fuels just to stay warm at home in winter.  She knows it is the worst thing for their health and the environment. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to buying the building materials to install insulation and repair the walls and roof of her house, and cover the cost for hired builders.

loans.use: To buy building materials to insulate and repair her old house and cover the cost for hired builders.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, a borrower from Iraq, is 43 years old, married and has five children. A tailor working from home since 2010, she makes, repairs, and alters clothing such as suits, coats and trousers for women and children. With a deep understanding of local customers and their needs, she has a good reputation and is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Amal is requesting this $2400 loan to purchase a sewing machine, a generator, and some fabrics. She is aiming to increase her production and gain more profit. This will offer her the opportunity to provide better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, a generator and some fabrics.

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run is 38 years old, married, and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a small store selling vegetables in a local market in her neighborhood, earning about $4.00 per day to support the family. Run uses this to pay for food, allowances for her school-aged children, and for electricity and water. 

Run usually gets up in the early morning to buy vegetables in bulk from her suppliers and transports them to the marketplace. Her husband is also one of her suppliers, growing vegetables in a large scale field operation as well as in a backyard garden.

Run is now asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a stock of vegetables to sell in her store. This will enable her to increase her productivity and augment her household income. She hopes to receive this loan from lenders to improve her current business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en:
Adolfina is a 43-year-old lady who lives with her husband and family in a simple house constructed half by brick and with walls of palm branches. She has four children: Desi, 20, and Nefri, 18, both graduated from junior high school; and Marthina,15 and Marthen,13, both attending junior high school.  

Adolfina assists her husband in meeting their daily needs by running a pig-breeding business and selling vegetables. She wakes up at 3.30 a.m. and goes to market to purchase vegetables to resell. After her vegetables are sold out, she returns home to continue taking care of her family and looking after the pig. Adolfina’s husband is in charge of selling crops, using a cart at the local market. 

Adolfina realized that education is very important for her children future.  Therefore she needs more business capital to enable her to generate more income. She plans to invest her money in the business, so she will be able to send her two older children to study at the university. To do so, Adolfina is requesting loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She plans to spend the loan on two piglets and more vegetables to resell. She really hopes that her dream will come true.

loans.use: to buy two more piglets to raise and more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
This is Trinidad, a 48-year-old resident of Manila, Philippines, is married to Julio, a vendor, and a mother to her children. She and her husband and children manage their household while operating their businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Trinidad operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not just a family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, Trinidad is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy more quantities of meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Trinidad dreams of growing her business and being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work. She also hopes to have her own restaurant someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tsogsuren

texts.en:
Tsogsuren, 47, is a driver who carries passengers between cities in Mongolia. He started his business in 2010 and has a lot of permanent customers. He can carry a maximum of four passengers at one time, and each passenger pays him $8.  

He lives with his wife in the ger district (a ger is a traditional Mongolian nomadic yurt) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All of his children have moved out of the house already. 

Tsogsuren owns an old car that runs on gasoline, but it uses too much petrol and emits toxic smoke into the air. Most spare parts for it have been bad and out of date. So he decided to replace his car with a better one that uses natural gas. He thinks that using natural gas is healthier and will help the environment. Also he believes he is doing it for his descendants and their future. Now he needs some money to cover the remaining cost of purchasing a natural-gas-engine car.

loans.use: To cover the remaining cost of his purchasing a natural-gas-engine car to replace his old car.

loans.name: Jilani

texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Jilani bought a machine for shoe designing, increasing his working capital slightly. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan, because his sellers have requested more products, as they have an established clientele, and Jilani's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why his Kiva loan will be successful. He will respond to demand by buying leather and beads at a good price. Jilani tells the lenders that his Kiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you, and may they continue helping him.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for shoe designing.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old, from Nakuru, and married with two children who are aged between six years and two and half years old.

Samuel is a farmer and also has a quarry business which he runs. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a dairy cow. He hopes to be able to meet the demands of his clients.

He hopes to be a large scale farmer in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 51 years old and married with four children. Melchora works very hard to provide for them.

Melchora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Melchora has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other grocery products. 

In the future Melchora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has four children.

Mazen owns a car spare parts shop. He is been in this field since 2009. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their demands. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan in order to install shutters for the shop and increase inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to install shutters for the shop and increase inventory.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 31 years old and has three children. Concepcion has a common-law husband and three children who are in school.

Concepcion is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Concepcion has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain them.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca-weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Elsie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca-weaving.

loans.name: Catalino Samuel

texts.es: Catalino vive en el norte de Guayaquil en el sector conocido como las Orquídeas, en su domicilio mantiene una tienda de venta de víveres. Empezó su vida comercial vendiendo alitas y chuzos por la ventana de su casa hace varios años, poco a poco fue implementando su tienda comprando productos de mayor salida como arroz, azúcar, aceite pasando un tiempo que se fue dando a conocer aumento su inventario. Luego de esto decidió acondicionar la tienda transformando la sala de su casa en un local, compro varias perchas y una nevera para ofrecer más productos. Catalino está casado y su esposa es ama de casa sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Con el crédito que está solicitando compra mercadería para vender en su tienda como arroz, azúcar, café, granos, productos de limpieza, pollos, carne, embutidos etc. la mayor meta de Catalino es ver crecer su negocio aumentando su rentabilidad  para poder incursionar en otra actividad que mejore su economía.
texts.en:
Catalino lives in northern Guayaquil in the area known as The Orquídeas (The Orchids).  In his home he has a general store.  He began his commercial life several years ago selling chicken wings and beef kabobs through the window of his house.  Little by little he began stocking his store, buying high volume products such as rice, sugar, and oil.  With time he was able to increase his inventory.  After this he decided to renovate the store, transforming his living room into the location for his store.  He bought several racks and a freezer in order to offer more products.  

Catalino is married and his wife works as a housewife.  His children are grown and independent.  With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy merchandise to sell in his store, like rice, sugar, coffee, grains, cleaning products, chicken, meat, and deli meats, etcetera.  Catalino's greatest goal is to see his business grow, raising his profits so that he can invest in other economic activities that will improve his income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, coffee, grains, cleaning products, chicken, meat, and deli meats.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her bangles selling business. She started her business five years ago to share the financial burden with her husband whose income was not enough for the whole family. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. All of them are getting their education. 

With this loan investment, Sajida will buy bangles of a larger variety and quantity that will help her make more sales and income - particularly for this coming Eid, which is a religious festival. Sajida is confident that by improving her business, she will be able to continue providing education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bangles for a bangles selling business

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren, 41, lives with her husband and three children in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She leases an apartment with two rooms by the month in the downtown above an internet café. 

Her husband makes snuff-boxes at home and sells them to customers and souvenir shops. Myagmarsuren’s family owns a small land plot and a house. She and her husband want to plant some vegetables for their private use and to sell to increase the family income. She is planning to build a greenhouse in her backyard in which to plant vegetables. For this she needs building materials, such as iron pipes, cement and other necessary materials. 

Also she has a plan to repair her house walls to insulate them. Her old house has heat loss through the walls and roof.

She is taking a loan to buy the building materials for a greenhouse and to insulate her house walls.

loans.use: To buy building materials for a greenhouse and to insulate her house walls.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is single and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca-weaving business.

Gemma has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca-weaving business.

loans.name: Grace Ann

texts.en:
Grace Ann works hard to support her family. Grace Ann is married and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Grace Ann requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca-weaving business.

Grace Ann has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Grace Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman and has three children who attend school. She lives in the Likoni Mombasa where she works at her fish-selling stall. For the past ten years, she’s has been operating her stall to support her home. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business more each time. She plans to use this loan to purchase bundles of fish for sale at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale with her Kiva loan. This will make the investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jelyn is 32 years old and two of her children are in school.

Jelyn has a raffia-making business in the Philippines. Jelyn requested a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her raffia-making business.

Jelyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her raffia making.

loans.name: Erika Anabel

texts.es: Erika se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, escogió esta actividad porque quería ayudar a su esposa con los gastos y como tiene 2 niños pequeños a quienes cuida no podía trabajar en una empresa. El trabajo es independiente y en la investigación que realizo le pareció rentable, empezó vendiendo bajo el código de otra persona pero esto no le ayudaba ya que quien ganaba las promociones por volúmenes de venta era su amiga. Cuando pudo reunir dinero para capitalizarse se acerco a la empresa y se registro con su propio código. El trabajo lo realiza sola haciendo recorridos y visitando a sus clientes ya sea para cobrar o entregar y recoger pedidos. Su horario normalmente es desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 y luego sale a las 15:00 hasta las 17:00 realiza este intervalo porque regresa a casa para atender a sus hijos. Erika vende productos como perfumes, maquillaje, lápices labiales etc., los cuales compra teniendo un margen del 30% en sus ventas. Vive en las Orquídeas y su esposo trabaja como chofer en una agencia de turismo. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos como perfumes, maquillaje, ropa y calzado para la venta esperada obtener mejores resultados. A futuro espera poder ponerse un negocio mejor establecido y así ayudar más en los ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Erika sells beauty products by catalogue. She chose this work because she wanted to help her husband with expenses and, as she has two small children to care for, she was not able to work for a business. She could work independently in this area and, in the investigation she conducted, it seemed to her that it was profitable. She began selling under another person’s account, but this did not help because it was her friend who won the sales promotions based on sales volumes and not her. When she was able to accumulate enough money to capitalize her own business, she went to the company and was registered with her own account. 

She works alone, traveling to visit her clients either to collect money or to take and deliver orders. Her schedule is normally from 9 in the morning until 11 a.m. and then she leaves again from 3 until 5 in the afternoons,  The interval at home allows her to take care of her children. Erika sells products such as makeup, lipsticks, etc., which she buys on a margin of 30% of sales. She lives in Las Orquideas and her husband works as a driver for a tourist agency. She will use the loan to buy products such as perfume, makeup, clothing and footwear and expects to earn more profit when she sells them. In the future she hopes to be able to have a better established business and thus help more with household income.

loans.use: to purchase makeup, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 56 years old. She is still very active and operates a shoe-making business. Her husband collects orders from the market, and both Sakina and her husband fulfill those orders by making shoes. The quality of their shoes is very good, which helps them get a good number of orders every month.

Sakina has seven sons, but she couldn’t provide them education due to financial constraints. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because she has a large order to fulfill. With the loan investment she will buy leathers and shoe laces in larger quantity and of better quality, which will help her completing the orders on time.

She has been operating this business with her husband for many years and is confident about her family's business success after receiving the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding Asasah Passbook is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy leather and laces for her shoe making and selling business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 31 years old and married with three children who are aged between 5 and 15 years old and are school-going.

Lucy has a green grocer business and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy green grams, beans, and rice to add to her business stock for sale.

She hopes to expand her business and educate her children to university in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of green grams, beans, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 34 years old. She is married to John and together they have one child aged 14 years old. She operates a green grocery and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits for sale.

She hopes to purchase a plot of land where they can put up a house.

loans.use: to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 33, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Felicito. She is the mother of three children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory, and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Vilma hopes to have her own house and that her children will have a good quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Leonila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonila requested a 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Leonila has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 38 years old and married with three children. He runs a green grocer business. He has been in this business for five years earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more stock of assorted vegetables, carrots and tomatoes for sale. He plans to use the anticipated profit to increase and expand the business.

His future hopes and dreams are to meet his clients' needs and achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted vegetables, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca-weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Lorna's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Lorelie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Coralia

texts.es: La señora Coralia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un taller de costura y bordados desde hace 8 años  e invertirá el crédito en la compra de telas, hilos, elástico, manta, crochet.
texts.en: Coralia is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has had a sewing and embroidery workshop for 8 years. She will invest the loan in buying fabric, thread, elastic, blankets and crocheted items.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Holman

texts.es:
El señor Holman quien se dedica a la agricultura actividad que aprendió desde muy joven. El crédito lo invertirá en el cultivo de tomate y en mejoras al invernadero.
Él está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 8 y 6 años los cuales estudian.
texts.en:
Holman is a farmer. He learned this activity when he was very young. He will invest the loan in growing tomatoes and in improving his greenhouse. 

He is married and has four children, aged 14, 12, 8 and 6. They are in school.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has an abaca weaving business. As the married mother of six children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

Lilia is borrowing PhP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She is confident that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to repair and renovate the family home.

loans.use: to buy materials for abaca weaving

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Héctor es mecánico de profesión con muchos años de experiencia, vive en la Orquídeas y su casa es de ladrillo contando con todos los servicios básicos. Empezó trabajando a los 21 años en un taller como ayudante de mecánica, su mayor reto era aprender para en un futuro ser independiente. En la actualidad tiene un taller pero realiza más su trabajo a domicilio. Héctor también tiene una camioneta en la cual brinda el servicio de fletes, estas dos actividades son las que le ayudan a solventar su economía. Realiza el trabajo solo y no tiene un horario establecido como es soltero pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo fuera de casa. El crédito que solicita y espera conseguir es para mejorar su vivienda ya que no tiene acabados, comprara arena, cemento, piedras, baldosas.
texts.en:
Héctor is a mechanic with many years of experience.  He lives in Orquídeas, and he has a brick house with all of the basic services.

When he was 21 years old he started working in a shop as an assistant mechanic.  His biggest goal was to learn in order to become independent in the future.

He currently has a shop, but he does more home-based work.  Héctor also has a pick-up truck with which he provides freight service.  These two business activities are those that help him settle his finances.

He works alone, and he does not have an established schedule.  As he is single, he spends most of his time away from home.

The loan he is requesting and hoping to get is to improve his home because it is not finished.  He will buy sand, stones, and tiles.

loans.use: to buy sand, stones, and tiles.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has a raffia making business. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She is unmarried and works hard to help support her extended family.

Rosalie requested a PhP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raffia for her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raffia for her business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is married with five children.  He operates a retail shop and has been in this business for ten years.  Raphael's monthly income is eleven thousand shillings.

This will be his third loan from KADET LTD and he plans to purchase more rice, sugar and flour for sale.

Raphael plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business.  His future hopes and dreams are to have a well and comfortable life and to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 55 years old. She is a widow, the mother of five grown children. She is a poultry farmer, besides owning a hotel and a posho mill for grinding maize and other grains.  She has been in the business for the past four years. She gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.


This will be her first loan through KADET LTD.  She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase chicks and chicken feeds so as to boost her poultry farming.


She hopes to seek medical help for her heart problem after her business stabilizes.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds to boost her poultry farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a business selling wine, spirits, and soft drinks. She started her business because of her need to generate an income to improve her family’s standard of living. Mary lives with her husband and their two children. Her main clients are her neighbors and members of the local community. 

Mary is requesting her second loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for two years and that made it possible for her to set up her business. She will use the loan to buy crates of beer and soda and to renovate her business. Such renovation will allow her to respond to opportunities in the market, such as attracting new customers that have been referred by current buyers and to market her establishment to new clients. This is the reason she is asking for this Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust. With her loan, she will also buy supplies in larger quantities, which will allow her to buy at a cash discount and obtain wares in larger volumes.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and soda and to renovate her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 34 year old married man who has a daughter who is three years old.  He describes himself as a determined man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells machinery.  He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member.  His business is located at a lucrative area and his primary customers are locals. 

Francis describes his biggest business challenge is the high cost of machinery.  He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more machinery for his shop. 

His business goal is to expand within five years.  Francis hopes that in the future, he will have opened many more mechanic shops.

loans.use: to buy more machinery.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is from Likoni.  He drives a motorcycle taxi, is married and has two children.

He has worked as a taxi driver for 4 years.  Ian lives with his family and decided to start this business, thinking of his own progress and that of his family.

Ian remarks that his job is very difficult because during the rainy season he has a lot of challenges since there are fewer passengers, since it's cold.  His dream is to buy more motorcycles and to progress more every day.

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job.  He is happy for opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 24 years old from Nakuru, and is married with three children who are between five and one years of age.

He has a motorcycle business that he started two years ago.  He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

Julius hopes to build his own house in the near future and expand his transport business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Nuru runs a food stall business. She has been engaged in her business for one year now. She works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. She is in her early 30s and is unmarried.

This will be Nuru's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She intends to use her loan funds to increase the stock of items for her food stall. Nuru will share this loan with her loan group Sisi Kwa Sisi, which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Her dream is one day to be able to own a hotel.

loans.use: to increase the stock of items for her food stall

loans.name: Las Chicas Superpoderosas Group

texts.es:
Este comité de la ciudad de San Ignacio está en el ciclo nº 5,  mantienen el grupo por medio de sus reuniones y ayudas mutuas..El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es seguir trabajando, fomentar el espiritu solidario y mantener la unidad y la disciplina del grupo.
La sra.Maria es parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de joyas, como ser pulseras, anillos, cadenas, aros y demás. Ella tiene buena habilidad para las ventas, y es por ello que le va muy bien y esta creciendo con su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas de plata, con lo cual podrá seguir creciendo y ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee, from the city of San Ignacio, are on their fifth loan cycle.  They keep the group going through their meetings and mutual help.  The aim of every member is to continue working, promoting a supportive spirit and maintaining group unity and discipline.

Maria is a member of this group.  She says that her business is selling all kinds of jewelry such as bracelets, rings, chains, earrings, etc.  She is very skilled in making sales and so she is doing very well and growing her business.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy silver jewelry.  This will help her to continue growing her business and offering a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam attracts many clients because he is a sociable person. He can quickly make the acquaintance of many people and develop his business. 

For more than thirty-four years he has been busy with driving. At first, he worked in the carpet factory as a driver, but after some time he was in labor reduction and stopped his activity in the factory. 

He hired a bus for serving local people going from one place to another. Uktam is persevering and his hard work helped him to develop his business. Now he has his own minibus and his business has been developing year by year. 

Uktam’s family is large. He has a lovely wife and five children. His wife is a housewife and that’s why Uktam must comfort his family with all necessary things alone. 

His house is small for his large family. He is going to build a new house but he does not have the money for it. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials to build a new house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to build a new house.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.es:
El señor Expedito tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty. El es Comerciante, de profesión FOTOGRAFO, se dedica a la producción de Fotografías y Video Filmaciones en general. Tiene experiencia de 30 años en este trabajo.
Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela debido a que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y trata de dar lo mejor de si en cada proyecto que tiene. Su meta es poder tener un gran estudio de fotografía y poder seguir trabajado y creciendo como microempresario.
Solicita el crédito que será destinado a la compra de una maquina reveladora para poder aumentar de producción y así por crecer económicamente y profesionalmente.-
texts.en:
Expedito is 47 years old and lives in the city of Curuguaty.  He is a photographer by profession.  He takes photos and makes videos.  He has 30 years experience in this work.

Expedito says that he has a very good customer base because he always does good work and tries to give his best in every project that he undertakes.  His goal is to have a large photography studio.  He would like to continue working and growing as a micro-businessman.

Expedito is requesting this loan to buy a photo developing machine so that he can increase his production and grow both financially and professionally.

loans.use: to buy a photo developing machine

loans.name: Choga

texts.en:
Choga lives in Kwale, Kenya. He is the father of seven children, all of whom still attend school. He works in the traditional art of dressmaking. 

With this activity, he has generated income to support his household while he was selling clothes. He needed to attain economic independence, to support their children’s well-being, and provide professional education so that they can be successful in the future.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan. He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials and supplies to make uniforms for school-going children. He has orders and he needs to make purchases in large volume to earn good discounts so that his offer will be competitive. 

His goal for later on is to attain a good market position, to hire employees, and to dedicate himself to running his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies to make uniforms for school-going children.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Isabel, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica a su actividad principal que es la de administrativa en un colegio de la ciudad, pero también se dedica a una actividad paralela y no menos importante que es la artesanía, principalmente en la elaboración de elementos bordados,. Isabel en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar material como Hilos de colores y telas para realizar sus bordados.
Isabel está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our partner is Isabel. She belongs to the communal bank Los Lideres (The Leaders) in the city of Cusco, Perú. She works as an administrator at a school in the city, but she is also dedicated to a parallel activity of no less importance: handicrafts, mainly the production of embroidered works.

With this opportunity, Isabel will use the requested loan to buy material, like colored thread and fabric, for her embroidery. Isabel is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to provide a better quality of life for her family and for helping her with the growth and strengthening of her work. She appreciates the loan and is committed to paying off her debt in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: To buy material, such as thread, for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Wani

texts.en:
Wani, age 30, runs a general store. He has been in business for four years. He lives in Juba with his wife and two children, ages three and five. The children are both enrolled in school. 

Wani heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion by the officers. He is taking out a loan of 3,500 SDG in order to purchase milk, sugar, tea leaves,  and other such items. The family has no other source of income.

In five years, Wani would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices.

Wani reports that he is happy to be the recipient of this loan given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase such items as milk, sugar, and tea leaves to offer for sale

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared  is a 43-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. He runs an insurance service business where he sells insurance policies. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a lucrative business area  and his primary customers are residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low demand for purchase of the policies. 

Jared will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a computer. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have opened a retail store for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Las Roseñas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Las Roseñas"se origino por medio de una de las miembros del grupo. Actualmente este grupo trabaja unido y se ayudan las unas a las otras y siempre tratan de ser mejores cada día.
Julia es una de las miembros de este grupo y cuenta que tiene una peluquería donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Es una persona muy sacrificada con muchos deseos de crecer y de superarse y darle lo mejor a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuague, tijeras y demás insumos para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y también poder darle una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Las Roseñas" Communal Bank was started through the efforts of one of its members. Currently this group works as a team that helps one another. They always try to improve every day.

Julia is one of the members of this group. She owns a beauty shop where she works every day starting very early. She is a person who has made many sacrifices and who greatly wants to grow and succeed and give the best to her family. She is applying for a loan to buy tints, shampoo, conditioner, scissors and other supplies in order to be able to continue helping her family and also to be able to provide good service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase tints, shampoo, condition, scissors and other supplies.

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has six children.

Jasem owns a food market since 2011, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is becoming well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $3000 as a loan in order to buy two refrigerators and a small generator. He also wants to increase supplies. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and a small generator

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 33 years old, married and a father of two children. For the last five years, he has earned a living by selling goods from his hardware based in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 25,000.

 He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan, of KES 100,000, to buy additional stock such as paint brushes, paint, door locks, and hammers for sale.

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his children's school fees and continue taking care of his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business into a well established hardware store in the region so that he may be able to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as paint brushes, paint, door locks, and hammers

loans.name: Leodegario

texts.en:
Leodegario is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 58 years old and married with three children. To make a living, Leodegario is providing a junkshop business in the local community. Leodegario has been engaged in his business for six years and earns 15,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Leodegario joined Kiva partner GDMPC. Leodegario is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to buy more junk items to resell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy more junk items to resell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Vilma is in an agricultural business raising hogs in the Philippines. She requested an 18,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Vilma has been hog raising for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is married with four children. She is 58 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. To earn a living, Martina has a small general store. She has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her snack vending business. 

Martina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months. In the future, Martina hopes to grow and sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her snack vending business

loans.name: James Martin

texts.en:
James  is a 40-year-old  businessman  who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 18  and 5. All of them go to school.

James  runs a general store and has been in business for eight years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through a  promotion by the officers. He is taking a loan of  4000 SDG to purchase milk, sugar, tea leaves  and many other items.  In addition to this business, James has no other source of income.

In five years James  would like to expand his business and open other  branches. His  major challenges include high  prices in the market.

James  says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  through  the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like milk, oil, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is an entrepreneur who has made progress in his goal thanks to his capacity for work and love for his family, which consists of his six children. He is the owner of a business through which he generates income for the family, managing his business of selling goat meat.  

Little by little Mohamed has been able to expand what he offers; delivering his products to clients on time, now he has a domestic market made up of his neighbors. His dream is to grow and expand his market, but his working capital is often insufficient in order to meet his goal of prosperity. This is the reason for which he is asking for a Kiva loan, his second financing through the Yehu Microfinance Trust, in order to purchase more goats with which he will be able to get substantial discounts by buying in volume. This is the groundwork for the success of his Kiva loan that has him enthused and dreaming.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 62 years old with  eight children.  She is married and lives in Cabal-asan, Maria, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Victoria is a farmer and grows assorted vegetables in the backyard. She has been doing this for 10 years. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase materials for constructing a "vermi-composting" system to produce an organic fertilizer as the major usage in the garden.

Victoria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months.  In the future, Victoria hopes to have more savings deposit out of income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a vermi-composting business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 6 años y es dueña de su propio negocio de internet. Gracias a FINCA Perú ella pudo tener su negocio propio y mejoró la economía de su hogar, le gustan las reuniones  de su Banco Comunal y las Ferias de Salud que brinda la institución. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la implementación del local de su negocio como la compra de estantes y el mantenimiento de sus computadoras.
texts.en: Gladys is a member of the Tarpuy II communal bank. She is 29 years old and a single mother of a 1 year old. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than 6 years and is the owner of her own internet business. Thanks to FINCA Perú, she was able to have her own business and improve her family's finances. She likes her communal bank's meetings and the health fairs that the institution offers. The loan that she is asking for will be invested in outfitting her business locale by buying shelves and doing maintenance on her computers.

loans.use: to buy shelves and to do maintenance on her computers.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rodrigo, a carpenter, and a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Zenaida sells balut and some crackers.  A balut is a fertilized duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell. Popularly believed to be an aphrodisiac and considered a high-protein, hearty snack, balut are mostly sold by street vendors in the regions where they are available. It is commonly sold as street  food in thePhilippines. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of balut and crackers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Zenaida dreams of growing her business and being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for stocks of balut and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: Eduardo, de 50 años de edad, es originario de Managua, se dedica a atender una pulpería en su casa de habitación, el es padre de dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes. El  comenzó su negocio  hace 4 años ya que tenía necesidad de generara ingresos para mantener la educación de sus hijos y pagar los gastos de su hogar. Antes se dedicaba a vender productos y  atender un cyber pero no era suficiente para pagar los gastos pero poco a poco fue poniendo productos en su casa para vender y después de un tiempo logro pone su pulpería. Este se ha convertido en su único medio de subsistencia y con el cual ha mantenido a su familia. El tiene como expectativa lograr convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora bien surtido donde sus clientes encuentren de todo lo necesario para abastecer sus hogares de productos alimenticios.
