El está requiriendo el préstamo Kiva para comprar granos básicos, leche, pan , huevo, jugos, papel de baño, productos de limpieza , ya que son de mucha necesidad y demanda entre su clientela .  También tiene como proyecto alquilar cuartos para estudiantes y ofrecer este servicio ya que ha notado que tiene demanda entre los jóvenes que vienen de largo  a estudiar a la capital
texts.en:
Eduardo, 50, is a native of Managua. He runs a small store in his home and is the father of two sons, both of whom are independent. He began his business four years ago because he needed to generate an income to pay for his children’s education and to cover household expenses. Previously he sold products and ran a cyber café but did not earn enough to pay his expenses.  However, he gradually began moving products to his house to sell and after a time he succeeded in establishing his store. This has become his only source of income and he has been able to support his family. He plans to convert his store into a well stocked distribution center where his customers will find all they need to supply their homes with household products. 

Eduardo is requesting a Kiva loan to buy basic grains, milk, bread, eggs, juices, toilet paper, cleaning supplies because these are the items most requested by his customers. He also has a project in mind to rent rooms to students and offer this service because he has noticed that there is a demand among those students who travel a long distance to study in the capital

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, milk, bread, eggs, juice, toilet paper and cleaning products.

loans.name: Gavsiddin

texts.en:
Gavsiddin has operated an animal husbandry business for more than 3 years. He buys cattle, cares for them for 3 or 4 months and sells them to local people for a low price. He has many customers. many of them butchers. All of his customers are glad about his work because his cattle are fat and well cared for.

Gavsiddin has a lovely wife and a child. He loves his family very much. Since he wants to develop his business, Gavsiddin is asking a loan to buy young cattle. He needs your help and support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda y es madre de 9 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de flores. Ella dice que con la ayuda de FINCA Perú, logró ahorrar y comprar cosas para su vivienda e implementar más su negocio. Le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal donde dice que aprende mucho a ahorrar, a invertir en su negocio y también aprende como cuidar su salud. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de flores como margaritas, girasoles, rosas, claveles, etc.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Tarpuy II Communal Bank.  She is 65 years old, a widow and the mother of nine children. She sells flowers. She says that with the help of FINCA Peru, she was able to save and buy items for her home and expand her business. She enjoys the training workshops offered by her communal bank where, she says, she learns a great deal about saving and investing in her business.  She also learns how to take care of her health. 

She will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing flowers like daisies, sun flowers, roses and carnations.

loans.use: to purchase flowers such as daisies, sun flowers, roses, carnations, etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man who describes himself as very ambitious. He operates a retail store where he sells milk. Moses has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a conducive business area  and his primary customers are hotels and residents within the area. Moses describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy containers for milk storage. Moses' business goal is to be a milk supplier within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have improved his business.

loans.use: to buy milk storage containers.

loans.name: Celnape

texts.en:
Celnape, 35 years old, is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has three children. Celnape operates a general store in the local community, selling a variety of food and household products. She has been in business for 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from it.

Celnape is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2006, Celnape joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is an entrepreneur who has made progress in his goals thanks to his capacity for work and his love for his family, which consists of his wife and five children, all of whom attend school. He owns and manages a movie shop business and began a second business 2 years ago, selling goats for meat, Little by little, Suleiman has been able to expand what he offers - selling the latest movies and now having a domestic market made up of his neighbors. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy CD’s and the latest movies in large volume, so as to get substantial discounts. This is the groundwork for the success of his Kiva loan that enables him to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy CD’s and the latest movies

loans.name: Gai Bol

texts.en:
Gai is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children, aged 7 and 5, both attending school. Gai  has operated a bar/hotel for 6 years and has two  employees. He has no other source of income. Gai heard about Finance Sudan through its officers' promotion. He is taking a loan of  4,000 SDG to purchase chairs, beer, soda and many other items.  

Gai's major challenge is high  prices in the market. In 5 years, he would like to expand his business and open other  branches. Gai says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items such as fridges, soda, beer, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with seven children. 

Evelyn has a hog-fattening business and earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to be use in purchasing feeds. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 43-year old and married, with two children.  She lives in San Carlos, Tukuran. Her husband is a municipal employee. 

In order to add income in the family, Nenita entered into the business of buying and selling rice 10 years ago. Nenita usually gets PHP 10,000 per month.

With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Nenita was able to buy more rice products to sell because of the PHP 10,000 rendered to her. Nenita joined GDMPC in 2008. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more rice products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old, married, and the father of three children. For the last seven years, he has earned a living by repairing bicycles for residents of Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers.  He is applying for his third loan of KES 50,000, to buy additional equipment such as wrenches and a small welding machine for his business, which he is seeking to expand.

He will use the profits to pay his children's school fees as well as to continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to turn his workshop into a welding business, whereby he would be repairing almost anything that involves metal. This will enable him to improve his earnings and lift up his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment such as wrenches and a small welding machine.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be optimistic.

She operates a retail stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for selling. Her business goal is to restock her business within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business by opening a stationery retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en: Mavzuna wants for all women to wear beautiful clothes. With this aim, some years ago she began her own business selling women's clothes. She is a very successful business lady, as she knows all aspects of her trade very well. Her experience helps her develop her business. Her colleagues know her as glorious and intelligent. She has two children and a lovely husband. Mavzuna manages the business alone. She wants to have a wide assortment of goods, but she does not have the money for that, and that’s why she is asking for a loan from you. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for widening her assortment

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita used her previous loan to buy snack foods to sell.  Her business has grown up and become successful.  

She is now busy in her other type of business, hog raising. She's taking a new loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Setei

texts.en:
Setei is 27 years old, married to Saitoti and blessed with four children that they support. She has been a mixed crop farmer, for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES.10,000. 

He has applied for her second loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizers, pesticides, and pay for labor. 

She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business. Her dreams for the future are to have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like pesticides, fertilizers, and labor

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 30 years old and married with one child. She runs a farm and motorcycle business. She has been in this business for two years earning a monthly income of 21,000 shillings. This will be her second loan from KADET Ltd, which she will use to buy a dairy cow. She plans to use the anticipated profit to buy more livestock. She hopes to be a prosperous business lady in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy  cow

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is 42 years old and single with two children. She operates a green grocer business. She has been in this business for seven years, earning a monthly income of 8,100 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family. This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd, and she plans to use it to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to add stock and expand the business. She hopes and dreams to be stable in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits for sale

loans.name: Lovilla

texts.en:
Lovilla is single and has no children. She is 27 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran.
Lovilla is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. Lovilla has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional feeds. 
Lovilla has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca has been able to operate her retail shop business thanks to her previous Yehu loans with which she had bought supplies such sundry products in large quantities. Currently, she is applying for a new Kiva loan which she will use to buy supplies, expecting an increase in product needs. She can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual. She sends the following message to the Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy supplies, expecting an increase in product needs.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 5 years and 10 years. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail stall where she sells plastic items such as water bottles. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a residential area  and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more plastic items to resell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have opened new retail stores selling plastics.

loans.use: to buy plastic bottles for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a married woman with 2 children. She is 45 years old, residing in San Carlos, Tukuran. Gloria owns and operates a business venture, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair the borrower's fishing boat. Gloria has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Gloria wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: to repair the borrower's fishing boat

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 4 children. She is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosita is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 36 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to acquire a lot for her investment .

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like pesticides, fertilizer, and labor

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old from Nakuru and is married with three children who are all in school.

Margaret has a charcoal selling business which she has been doing for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more charcoal to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to educate her children well until they reach university level.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to add to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.name: Uzul

texts.ru:
Узул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее четверо детей. Узул мужественная и порядочная женщина. После того как ее муж покинул ее. Узул занялась животноводством. В этой области Узул имела богатый опыт, что помогло ей расширить свою деятельность и заработать чтобы обеспечит детей всем необходимым. 
На сегодняшний день Узул продолжает свою деятельность. В этом ей помогает ее старший сын. Животноводство - является единственным источником дохода в ее семье. Узул просит кредит для закупа овец и телят с целью увеличения поголовья скота. 
Узул хочет за счет полученной прибыли от продажи скота устроить свадьбу сына. Она надеется, что ее услышат.
texts.en:
Uzul lives in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan. She's a 46-year-old widow raising 4 children. Uzul is very respectable and courageous. After her husband left her, she started breeding animals to make a living. She's very experienced in this area and that has helped her to expand her business and earn enough money to ensure her children's needs are met. Today, she runs her business with the assistance of her oldest son. This is their only source of income. 

Uzul is asking for a loan in order to purchase some sheep and calves and increase the size of her herd. She plans to use some of the profits to pay for her sons wedding. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and calves.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
This is Alfred, 48, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is married to Gregoria, a vendor, and a father to his child. He, together with his wife and children, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses.  

Alfred sells balut and crackers. Balut, fertilized duck embryo boiled in the shell, is a popular street food in the Philippines. Alfred's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of balut and crackers. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Alfred dreams of growing his business and giving all his children a good education through all his hard work on his business. He also hopes to have his own restaurant. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: Don Pablo ,  originario, casado de Managua es un humilde comerciante el cual es dueño de un pequeño Cyber café ubicado en su casa de habitación, el junto con su hijo menor administran el negocio lleva 6 años con este negocio antes se dedica  la contabilidad pero al jubilarse decidió poner este negocio para buscar otra manera de sobrevivir y apoyar a su hijo quien estudia Ingeniería en sistemas, antes le ayudaba su hija mayor pero ella murió , esto le sirvió para poder soportar el dolor de haber perdido a su hija y de seguir adelante para no dejar caer el negocio. Impulsado por el deseo de superación y como una forma de rendirle honor a su hija el continua trabajando duro para brindar una mejor calidad en sus servicios tener maquinas un poco más modernas, acondicionar mejor el lugar pues la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes estudiantes quienes realizan sus tareas y proyectos en el Cyber  y ellos siempre buscan lo mejor y más moderno. Es por ello que está solicitando el crédito para comprar disco duros, monitores de computadoras, tarjetas de memoria, pintura para darle una mejor apariencia a los módulos donde tiene ubicadas las maquinas. Esto le será de mucha ayuda para poder brindar un mejor y diferenciado servicio a sus clientes quienes siempre buscan lo mejor. El tiene como meta poner el servicio ce llamadas internacionales, trabajar con tecnología avanzada y vender modernos software.
texts.en:
Don Pablo, married and a native of Managua, is an unassuming merchant who is the owner of a small cyber café located in his home. He, together with his youngest son, manages the business, which he has had for six years. Previously he was an accountant however when he retired he decided to start this business in order to find another way of surviving and supporting his son who was a student in systems engineering. Prior to that,  he had helped his older daughter, however she passed away. Assisting his son has helped him bear the pain of losing his daughter. It has enabled him to move forward and avoid losing his business.

Motivated by a wish to overcome the loss and as a way to honor his daughter, he continues working hard to offer a better quality of service, to have machines that are a bit more modern and to better equip the space. The majority of his clients are young students who do their homework and projects in the cyber café and they also look for the best and most modern products. Consequently he is requesting a loan to purchase hard disks, computer monitors, memory cards and paint to give a better appearance to the modules where the machines are located.  The loan will be a great help and enable him to offer better and specific services to his clients, who are always looking for the best.

Don Pablo’s goals are to install an international call service, to work with advanced technology and to sell modern software.

loans.use: to purchase hard disks, computer monitors, memory cards and paint.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 27 años de edad y es madre de 1 hijo. Es socia de socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años y se dedica a la venta de frutas por mayor y menor. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú ella pudo implementar su negocio que comparte con su mamá, logró aumentar su mercadería. Le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal y hace todo el esfuerzo para no faltar a ninguna reunión. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de frutas como naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, uvas, papayas, sandías, manzanas, etc., para llevar a las ferias y vender en su puesto.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Tarpuy II Communal Bank. She is 27 years old and the mother of a son. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years and sells fruit, both wholesale and retail. During her time as a member of FINCA Peru, she was able to start her business, which she shares with her mother, and to expand her merchandise.

She enjoys the training workshops offered by her communal bank and makes every effort to not miss a single meeting. The loan she is requesting will be invested in purchasing fruits, such as oranges, mandarins, bananas, grapes, papayas, watermelons, apples, etc, which she will take to the markets and sell from her stall.

loans.use: to purchase fruits such as oranges, mandarins, bananas, grapes, papayas, watermelon, apples, etc.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y madre de 12 hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad e independientes. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 5 años y tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ropa. Ella agradece a FINCA Perú porque con el primer préstamo que obtuvo logró abrir su negocio y ahora gracias a ese capital se encuentra bien y tranquila junto a su familia, también le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal por que le enseñan mucho y son divertidas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como ropa de invierno para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of Tarpuy II Communal Bank. She is 64 years old, married and the mother of 12 children, all of whom are adults and independent. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than five years and has a business buying and selling clothing. She is grateful to FINCA Peru because, with her first loan, she succeeded in starting her business and now, thanks to that capital, she and her family are happy and well.

She also enjoys the training workshops offered by her communal bank because they teach her a great deal and are entertaining. She will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing merchandise, such as winter clothing for men, women and children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as winter clothing for women, gentlemen and children.

loans.name: Ricarido

texts.en:
Ricarido is 52 years old and lives in Bernad Subdivision, Ozamiz City. He is married with 2 children. 

Ricarido has a store that sells a variety of products. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Ricarido has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 70 years old, married, and the father of three children. For the last 30 years, he has earned a living by farming and selling his produce to his clients in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his third loan, for KES 24,000, to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides to ensure that his produce is well taken care of. He will use the anticipated profit to continue looking after his family.

His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming so that he may continue providing his family with a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es: Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de quesos. Ella dice que le gusta ser parte de FINCA Perú por que aprendió mucho la puntualidad, también le gustan las Campañas de Salud por que son para personas de bajos recursos, se les da una oportunidad a las personas que no tienen dinero para asistir a un doctor. El préstamo que solicita  lo invertirá en la compra de queso para que lleve a vender a las ferias y el mercado.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is a member of the "Tarpuy II" communal bank. She is 43, married, and the mother of five children. She sells cheese.

She says that she likes being part of Finca Perú, because she really learned to make payments on time. She also likes the health campaigns because they are for low-income people. It gives people who don't have money the opportunity to go to a doctor. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of cheese that she will sell at fairs and markets.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cheeses.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is a clever woman with a high degree. She is a teacher in the local school. She has many pupils and all of them love her very much. Mavjuda works with pleasure because she likes her job. Her husband went to Russia to find a job. She has a son and cares about his future life. This year her son is going to be married to a lovely girl, but their house is small and in bad condition. Mavjuda wants to build a new house for him and his future wife. Her husband can’t help her and you are the only one who can help her. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials such as wood, cement, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement for building a new house

loans.name: Francis Nyamai

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old from Nakuru and is married with three children, who are aged between seven and 18. 

He has a scrap metal business that he has been running for the past seven years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more scrap metal to add to his stock.

He hopes to educate his children and expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal to add to his stock.

loans.name: Puissance De Philibert 4 Group

texts.fr:
Milain est le coordinateur de son groupe Puissance de Philibert 4. Il est marié et il a 3 enfants. Il habite dans la région philibert d’Haiti il n’a pas de l’éléctricité et de l’eau est très limitée.

Milain a dirigé son business de produit divers pendant les dernières 3 années. Milain voudrait utiliser d'investir dans l'achat de différents produits comme les cosmétiques, les vêtements, les chaussures. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à progresse

Des autres membres de puissance de Philibert ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Charbon, vêtements et produit divers.

Milain dit que son défi principal est manquement de l’argent. Il dit que son but principal être devenir un grand commerçant et est faire plus de bénéfice son rêve est acheter un véhicule.
texts.en:
Milain is the coordinator of his group "Puissance de Philibert 4".  He is married and has three children.  He lives in the Philibert region of Haiti where there is no electricity and where the water supply is very limited.

Milain has been managing his business for the past three years (he sells various goods).  He would like to use his loan to invest in the purchase of various goods such as cosmetics, clothes and shoes.  He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business.

The other members of the group "Puissance de Philibert" need a loan to finance such activities as the sale of charcoal, clothes and various goods.

Milain says that his main challenge is the lack of money.  His main goal is to become a major retailer and make more profits.  His dream is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as cosmetics, clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet says that the first loan has helped pay part of her children's school fees, and she has increased her business stock. She is also happy to take more loans from Finance Sudan. The other people in the photo are clients and a worker.

loans.use: to purchase more weaves, plastic chairs for the customers, and other related items.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is married, and leaves in Tiribe, Kenya. She is a good entrepreneur, and for three years she has owned her own business. She has operated a palm leaves for roof thatch selling business for the past three years.

Today her dreams continue to grow and her goals are to continue increasing her income. She plans to establish a retail shop business and expand to a wholesale shop and to be very successful.

Her market is growing and so is the amount of capital that she needs to continue providing the products her customers demand. This will be her first loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy bundles of palm leaves that she will promote in her business with special discounts. She wants to offer great prices to her customers so that she can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why she will be successful in investing her Credit Kiva loan in her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of palm leaves.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 24-year-old married woman. She has a son who is three years old. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail stall where she sells plastic items such as water bottles. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more plastic items. Her business goal is to restock her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will diversify her business whereby she looks forward to exporting her plastics to customers internationally.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items such as water bottles to sell.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with two children. She lives in Tiribe town, Kenya. She has sold household consumables at her Kiosk shop for the last year. Nzadze's business has allowed her to get ahead, to earn enough income to have some comforts. Her goal is to expand her business more so that she can expand her profits further. 

Nzadze is currently planning to take out her first credit thanks to Kiva, which will be her first funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy retail shop items like maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She generates good profits when she buys in bulk, which is what she plans to do in this instance.

loans.use: to buy retail shop items like maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with five children. Rosa is 47 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan Oroquieta City.

Rosa is engaged in buying and selling to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Rosa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with three children who are aged between 30 and 22 years old.

Cecilia is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm. 

She hopes to see her farm produce enough harvest and to make good income from it in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Benard is a 34-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from nine months to 11 years old. He describes himself as a jovial man. He operates a bicycle with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a profitable business area and his primary customers are local residents from the environs. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor impassible roads especially when it rains. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new bicycle to improve his mode of transportation for customers. His business goal is to expand his business into taxi transportation services within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new bicycle.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 42 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin. Juliet is married with three children. Juliet has a store that sells variety of products. Juliet has had this business for three years.

Juliet requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Hoan

texts.en:
Hoan, aged 28, appears in the photo with her spouse. They live happily in a small village in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. This couple has given birth to two children, both of whom are enrolled in a local school in the province. Hoan runs an off-license from her own home to supplement the main income of the family.  Her husband helps her in the business when he gets free from doing farm work.

Hoan wants to renovate her store and satisfy her clients, so she is taking out a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase timbers and construction supplies needed for the construction. This will enable her to make her business more viable and profitable in the future. She hopes that she will be able to earn a better income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase timbers and construction supplies needed to construct her store.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 35 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela. Riza is married with three children. Riza has a store that sells variety of products. Riza has had this business for five years.

Riza requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Riza has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Riza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Haydarhuja

texts.en:
Haydarhuja is a man who likes to work very hard. For more than 15 years he has worked in his garden from early morning till late evening. There are many fruit trees in his garden. He is busy preparing ‘kuraga’ (dried fruit) from apricots. Haydarhuja collects fresh apricots, dries them and makes ‘kuraga’ to sell to local people. Haydarhuja's wife and children help him in the business. His business from dried fruits gives enough income. 

His family need more income and that’s why he wants to develop his business further. This year he made few ‘kuraga’ and Haydarhuja wants to buy additional ‘kuraga’ to sell to local people. He is asking for a loan to buy ‘kuraga’ to expand his business. He awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy more kuraga to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El socio Jose nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la confección de zapatos y tiene un pequeño taller pero el local es alquilado. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Jose requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cuero, hilos, pegamento y otras cosas más.  El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: The member Jose was born in the province of Cusco and lives in the same city in which he was born. He is 36 years old and has a common law marriage from which he has two children. He belongs to the communal bank "Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta" and things are going very well for him thanks to his punctual payments of the dues. He makes a living making shoes and has a small workshop, but he rents these premises. He's been making a living doing this business for several years now and things are going very well for him. At this time Jose needs the loan to buy work materials like leather, thread, glue, and other things. The member is grateful for the loan and commits himself to fulfilling his payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy work materials like leather, thread, glue, and other things.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Marlene, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica al negocio de la diversión, ella tiene una discoteca, lugar donde uno puede ir a beber y bailar, es un negocio que representa mucho trabajo y sacrificio debido a que la atención es toda la noche. Marlene en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para la apertura de otra discoteca, ella comprará mobiliario como mesas y sillas para su club nocturno.
Marlene está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member is Marlene.  She belongs to the 'Los Lideres' community bank, in the city of Cusco Peru.  She is in the entertainment business and owns a discotheque where people can go to drink and dance.  It is a business that entails a lot of work and sacrifice because she has to work all night.  On this occasion, Marlene will invest the loan she has requested in opening another discotheque.  She will buy tables and chairs for her night club.

Marlene is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to offer her family a better quality of life and for helping her to grow and strengthen her businesses.

Marlene is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her new discotheque

loans.name: Ruth Carla

texts.es: La socia Ruth Carla nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a brindar servicio de  llamadas de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia Ruth Carla también se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas en diferentes fiestas de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Ruth Carla requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza y gaseosas.  La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ruth Carla was born in Cusco province and she lives in the city in which she was born.  She is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have one son.  Ruth Carla belongs to 'Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta' community bank and things are going well as she makes her loan repayments on time.  Her business is offering phone service as a street vendor.  She has been in this business for a number of years and it is doing very well.  She also sells beer and soda during different celebrations in the city of Cusco.  

On this occasion, Ruth Carla needs a loan to buy beer and soda.  She is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La socia Laura sigue dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de leche y crianza de animales menores como pollos,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus cientes que le solicitan ,tambien la socia se esta dedicando a la compra y venta de leña, la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de pollos para su negocio.
texts.en: Laura continues in her business buying and selling milk and raising young animals such as chickens.  She raises the animals and then sells them to her customers who request them.  She also buys and sells firewood.  Laura is a responsible person who has a great desire to continue working for the sake of her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy chickens for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
La socia Yeni sigue dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. La socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yeni continues raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She raises these animals and then sells them to customers who request them.  She has been in this business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into it.  This is how she provides for her family.

Yeni is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, chompas, blusas y chalecos, la socia vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo, para comprar pantalones, chalecos y polos.
  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Victoria is 48 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling clothing.  She sells pants, sweaters, blouses and jackets.  She sells independently and works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through her business she would like to make progress.  Her dream is to expand her clothing business.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, jackets and tops.

Victoria is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy pants, jackets and tops

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en el cultivo de maiz en dos manzanas de terreno, el cual realizara con su padre, los fondos prestados los invertirá en cinco sacos de sulfato y tres de fórmula, herbicidas e insecticidas, que son los necesarios para poder darle al cultivo el cuido y pueda ser más productivo.

Con el prestamo anterior cubrio la compra de una motocicleta, aun se encuentra tabajando en la comercial, actualmente realizara la siembra junto a su padre y pagara mozos para que le ayuden, la compra que realizo con el prestamo anterior le ha dado una mejor condición económica con su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest in the cultivation of corn on two blocks of land, which he will carry out with his father. He will invest the loaned funds in five sacks of sulfate, three sacks of formula, herbicides, and insecticides, which are necessary to be able to care for the crop and have it be more productive.

The previous loan covered the purchase of a motorcycle. He is still working in the business and will now carry out the sowing together with his father and pay young men to help him. The purchase that he made with the previous loan has given him a better financial condition for his family.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of sulfate and three of formula.

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal “Nuevo Edén” del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, una hija y es soltera.
Recién lleva año y cuatro meses en este banco comunal, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas al paso como salchipapas, este negocio lo tiene instalado en su propia casa y atiende por las noches, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 paquetes de gaseosas, 3 pollos, 18 kilos de papa, 5 paquetes de hot dot, 5 litros de aceite, 10 kilos de arroz.
Para que no esté sola su hija está viviendo en la misma casa que ella, con su hija a su lado se siente más tranquila y con más ganas de seguir trabajando, gracias a Manuela Ramos tiene un pequeño capital que le sirve para seguir con su negocio que solventa todos sus gastos.
texts.en: María is a member of the 'Nuevo Edén' community bank which is located in Yaranicocha district, in Ucayali department. She is 60 years old, single and has one daughter. María has been a member of this community bank for one year and four months. Her business is selling food such as salchipapas. Her business is located in her own home and she serves her customers at night. She has the help of her daughter. María will use this new loan for 1,500 soles to buy 5 packets of soda, 3 chickens, 18 kilos of potatoes, 5 packets of hot dogs, 5 liters of oil and 10 kilos of rice. So that she isn't on her own, María's daughter is living in the same house. With her daughter by her side, María feels more peaceful and has a greater desire to continue working. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she has a small amount of capital that she can use to continue in her business which covers all her expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil, soda and potatoes

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es:
La señora Katy es socia del banco comunal ”Nuevo Edén” del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado de su distrito y lleva tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su esposo es armador pesquero, en tiempo de pesca  pasa más tiempo en el rio aprovechando la temporada para poder tener más ingresos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles  comparará; 50 kilos de pescado sardinas, 50 kilos de doncella, 30 kilos de bagre.
Más adelante espera poder cambiar de negocio, tiene un pequeño capital para poner una tienda de ropas que piensa implementar poco a poco, todos estos años trabajó mucho para juntar este capital y que le va a servir para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Katy is a member of the 'Nuevo Edén' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 33 years old, married, and has three children.

Katy's business is selling fish in the market in her district.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  Her husband is a fishing boat owner.  During fishing season he spends more time on the river, making the most of the season to make more income.

With her new loan for 3,000 soles, Katy will buy 50 kilos of sardines, 50 kilos of doncella fish and 30 kilos of catfish.

In the future, Katy hopes to be able to change business.  She has a small amount of capital which she will use to set up a clothing store that she plans to stock gradually.  She has worked hard over the years to put this capital to one side and she will use it to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay, aged 59, owns and operates a farming business as the main source of income for her family. She has been engaged in this for over 20 years and earns approximately KHR 10,000 each day. She is married and a responsible mother of six children, living in a peaceful village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province.

Svay has been an honest client of HKL in order to gain access to financial services. She has previously received four loans and paid them off already. With those previous loans, she was able to augment her business activities, and improved her living conditions. As of now, she would like to have another loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a plot of land for farming. She believes that this loan will be given to her again to develop her current businesses. Svay wants to help her school-aged children earn degrees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is fifty-five years old, and is married with six children. He operates motorcycle transportation business. He has been in this business for ten years earning a monthly income of seven thousand shillings.

This will be his fifth loan from KADET Ltd. and he plans to use it to purchase spare parts and five goats to rear as he also plans to start livestock-rearing in future. 

He plans to use the anticipated profit for educating the children and expanding the business. His future hopes and dreams are to own a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motor cycle and five goats to rear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to expand his hydroponic greenhouse and buy seeds

loans.name: Custodio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Custodio; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, el socio vende textiles y mantas, el socio tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de tienda de artesanía. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como mantas y textiles.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Huayna Picchu community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Custodio. He is 43 years old and lives with his partner and has one son. He alternates his daily work with a business selling crafts. He sells textiles and blankets. He has a shop where he works from 8AM until 6PM. Through this work, he gets his son ahead. The member's dream is to expand the crafts business. He is requesting the loan to buy crafts like blankets and textiles. The member is happy for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy crafts like blankets and textiles.

loans.name: Selene

texts.es:
La socia Selene sigue dedicandose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio a la vez la socia tambien continua con la compra y venta de leche,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Selene continues working in her business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She raises these animals and then sells them to customers who request them.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She also continues buying and selling milk.  This is how she provides for her family.

Selene is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha sigue dedicandose al negocio de brindar servicio de transporte y a la compra y venta de frutas,la socia es una persona responsable y con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia lleva buen tiempo en sus negocios los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a cada uno de ellos,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de fruta al por mayor como platanos.
texts.en:
Bertha continues in her business providing a transport service and buying and selling fruit.  She is a responsible person who has a great desire to continue working for the sake of her family.  She has been in her businesses for a long time and they are doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into each one.  This is how she provides for her family.

Bertha is requesting this loan to buy fruit such as bananas wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas wholesale

loans.name: Liset Vanessa

texts.es: La socia Liset Vanessa nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella se dedica a brindar servicio de  llamadas de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. La socia Liset Vanessa también se dedica a la venta de artesanía y lleva sus productos a vender al país de Bolivia. En esta oportunidad Liset Vanessa requiere el préstamo para comprar carteras y billeteras de cuero. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Liset Vanessa was born in the province of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is dedicated to providing telephone service on foot. She has already been dedicated to this business for many years and it's going very well. Liset Vanessa is also dedicated to selling crafts and takes her products to sell to the country of Bolivia. At this time, Liset Vanessa requires the loan to buy leather handbags and wallets. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments in accordance with the deadlines.

loans.use: to buy leather bags and wallets.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesanía, la socia vende mantas,chompas,aretes,collares,guantes y gorros, la socia tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo, para comprar mantas, chompas, collares y guantes.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'Huayna Picchu' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Yenny is 30 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling handicrafts.  She sells blankets, sweaters, earrings, necklaces and hats.  She has a store where she works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  This is how she provides for her child.  Yenny's dream is to expand and improve her handicrafts business.  She is requesting this loan to buy blankets, sweaters, necklaces and gloves.

Yenny is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more sweaters, gloves and necklaces

loans.name: Jonias

texts.en:
Jonias is a 28-year-old man. He is married to Antonetha, a 25-year-old lady. They are blessed with Hazel, a one-and-a-half-year-old boy. Jonias supports his little family by working as an employee. Even though he receives a regular income from being an employee, it cannot fully cover his family necessities. In order to raise his income, Jonias purchased a used minivan a year ago to be used as a public transportation to carry materials from the building construction shop to the customer’s house. From the public minivan business, Jonias is able to earn IDR 70,000 – 100,000, within a day. The extra income from the business enables Jonias to better cover his family living costs as well as to help his parents in meeting the educational cost of his youngest brother.

Jonias would like to replace the old and broken car’s spare parts i.e. tires, etc. In addition he also wants to put aside some money for his wife's maternity costs. Therefore, Jonias is requesting loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 to implement his plan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his old and broken car and also put aside some money for his wife's maternity costs.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 42 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela. Dina is married with two children. Dina has a store that sells variety of products. Dina has had this business for three years.

Dina requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Dina has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Dina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Jemmianus

texts.en:
Jemmianus, a 25-year-old mason, is married to Maria, a 24-year-old lady. They have a four-year-old daughter named Catharina. Maria has also brought her young brother, Fidentus, 19 years old, to live with them.

Jemmianus has been working as a mason for five years; in building a house, he usually works with his colleagues and the payment is fairly divided. Jemmianus prefers to work by himself when he gets a small order i.e. to build up a room or renovate a small part of a house, etc. Jemmianus cannot deny that the income from being a mason is very limited in meeting the needs of his family; on the other hand the limited number of mason tools has also been an obstacle for him in getting larger orders.  

Jemmianus has a dream of improving his income by purchasing more mason tools i.e. a ripsaw, a hacksaw, a hammer, etc.  By having more tools Jemmianus will be able to receive many orders. He also would like to purchase several building materials to continue building his house. To make it happen, Jemmianus requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. He is hoping that the loan assistance would enable him to reach his dream.

loans.use: to purchase more mason tools such as a ripsaw, a hacksaw and a hammer, and also to purchase building materials for his house.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica operates a poultry business to earn a living, operating it from her home. However, she still owns a fruit and vegetable selling business where her daughter assists her. Margaret has been in this business for four years. She also depends on her husband's salary.

Margaret had previously acquired a loan from Yehu and Kiva, which helped her to grow her business. She has also learnt the importance of saving because she has been trained in financial management and farming methods. She dreams of owning some dairy cows to be a supplier of milk in the region. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana Maria sigue dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de queso,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia tambien sigue dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de granos secos como maiz,cebada,trigo entre otros,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de granos secos como maiz.
texts.en:
Ana Maria continues in her business buying and selling cheese.  She has been in this business for a long time and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She makes her sales as a street vendor, selling to customers who request her products.  She also continues in her business buying and selling dried grains such as corn, barley, wheat, etc.  This is how she provides for her family.

Ana Maria is requesting this loan to buy dried grains such as corn.

loans.use: to buy dried grains such as corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new car for organizing new business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old, married to Tecla, and both have five children aged between four to 16 years. He is into agriculture specifically tea planting and has been in operation for four years earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This is his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase tea seedlings for planting. He plans to use the profits gained on starting small-scale dairy farming. 

His hopes and dreams are that his business prospers so that he can provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Maritar

texts.en:
Maritar is 52 years old and lives in Samburu, in the Mombasa west region of Kenya. She is married and has two adult children. For over seven years, Maritar has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells a variety of consumer products such as sugar, flour, etc.

To help expand her business, Maritar has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar, cooking oil, beans, etc, for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Maritar hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up another retail shop, thanks to her hard work despite her old age.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar, cooking oil, beans, etc

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is a resident living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She is 52 years old, widowed, and has four children. She manages a farming business, growing annual rice crops to provide enough sustenance for the family. Aside from agriculture, Heng also operates a grocery store from a rented booth situated in a local market of the province. She serves breakfast, lunch and soft drinks to her customers, earning USD 5 per day on average. Her daughter serves her as her motivation in this retail business. 

Heng wants to upgrade her living standard through her hard work and perseverance. To provide her children a healthy living, Heng decided to take out an additional capital of USD 500 to purchase construction supplies such as cements, bricks, and iron construction rods, which will be used to build a bath room and toilet for home use. This will provide her family with a comfortable living status. For her business goal, she wants to owns a grocery store and expand it gradually to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, and iron construction rods, which will be used to build a bathroom and toilet for home use.

loans.name: Miryan Monserrate

texts.es: Miryan tiene 36 años y vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, Génesis de 12 años Melany de 9 años y Kelly de 8 años quienes asisten a la escuela. El barrio donde vive Miryan tiene poco tiempo de haberse fundado por lo que se casa es de caña y tiene solo l servicio de luz, el agua se consigue por tanqueros que venden a los moradores. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de cintas para todo tipo de eventos, banderas y vende productos de belleza por catálogos. El negocio lo empezó hace 5 años cuando su esposo perdió el trabajo se encontró con la necesidad de empezar un negocio y vio la oportunidad de trabajar en algo que le gusta y ganar dinero, una de las ventajas de su negocio es que en el sector nadie más tiene este negocio. Miryan realiza la labor en compañía de su esposo en la casa ya que los clientes vienen a pedir las cintas con el logotipo de que desean para comenzar la elaboración. Con el crédito que está solicitando desea comprar telas, pelón, escarcha, cordón y pegamento, estos son los principales materiales que emplea. Su mayor sueño es poder tener un taller para poder ampliar su negocio y luego empezar poco a poco la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Miryan is 36 years old and lives in the city of Portoviejo. She is married and has three children: Genesis, 12, Melany, 9, and Kelly, 8, who attend school. The neighborhood where Miryen lives was established only recently so her house is made of cane and she has only electric light service. She gets water from tankers who sell to residents. She is dedicated to making scarves for all kinds of events, flags and selling beauty products from catalogs. She started the business five years ago when her husband lost his job and she found the need to start a business and saw the opportunity to work in something that she liked and earn money. One of the advantages of her business is that in her area no one else has this business. Miryan works alongside her husband at home since customers come to request the scarves with the logo that they wish in order to start the fabrication. With the loan that she is requesting, she is wishing to buy fabric, glitter, lace and glue. These are the main materials she uses. Her greatest dream is to be able to have a shop to be able to expand her business and then gradually begin the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, glitter, lace and glue.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa han emprendido su nueva meta construir su casa entre los dos se apoyan con los gastos del hogar el labora como conductor en una empresa Privada ella como Docente en un colegio Privado pero su dificultad  mas grande es que no pueden recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para comprar los  materiales a necesitar, con este finaciamiento ellos podran comprar: Ceramica, Puertas de Madera, Indoro completo con todos sus accesorio, Arena y Cemento. ellos muy contentos por que Afodenic ha confiado en ella y esperan seguir contando con este apoyo.
texts.en: Maria lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  She and her husband have undertaken a new goal of building their home.  They both support each other with the household expenses.  Maria's husband works as a driver with a private company and she works as a teacher in a private school.  Their biggest difficulty is that they are not able to put together enough money in one go to buy the materials they need.  With this loan they will be able to buy tiles, wooden doors, a toilet with all its accessories, sand and cement.  They are very happy that Afodenic have placed their trust in them and they hope to continue receiving this support.

loans.use: to buy tiles, doors, cement, sand and a toilet

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Felicitas, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de la confección de muebles para el hogar y oficina. Felicitas en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar materiales como madera y tapices para la confección de sus muebles.
Felicitas está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Los Lideres community bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She continues to work at her furniture store, which has furniture for both the home and the office.  

Felicitas would like to use this loan to purchase materials such as wood and upholstery fabric to make her furniture.  

Felicitas is very happy with Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and to help them with the growth and strengthening of their activities.  She appreciates the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wood and upholstery fabric.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del banco comunal “Nuevo Edén” del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos mayores.
Ella brinda servicio de fotocopias y lleva trabajando seis años con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, su esposo trabaja junto a ella y la apoya.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una impresora y una nueva copiadora  para cambiar la que ya tiene porque es muy antigua.
Su negocio funciona en su  casa y no tiene que pagar alquiler de local, cosa que es muy favorable para ellos y los ingresos que tiene les alcanza para vivir y poder seguir manteniendo su negocio, agradecen a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo brindado a su persona, y espera seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Martha is a member of the New Eden community bank from the Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old, is married and has two adult children. She provides photocopy service and has six years' experience working with the Manuela Ramos loans. Her husband works with her and supports her. With her new loan of S. 2,000.00, she will buy a printer and a new copier to change the one she has since it is very old. Her business operates from her house and she does not have to pay to rent a shop, something that is very favorable for them. The income they earn lets them live and be able to keep maintaining their business. They are thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support provided and hope to keep working.

loans.use: to buy a printer and copier.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La socia Mónica nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes y otros más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Mónica requiere el préstamo para comprar collares, aretes y otros más. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Mónica was born in the province of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born.  She is 22 years old and single.  She is a member of the Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta community bank, which is going very well thanks to their punctual payments.  

She works selling beauty products such as perfumes, earrings, and other items.  She has had this business for a few years and it is going very well.  

Mónica is requesting this loan to purchase necklaces, earrings, and other items.  She appreciates the loan and promises and make her payments on time according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase necklaces, earrings, and other items.

loans.name: Nolyene

texts.en:
Nolyene is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from two to five. She describes herself as a honest and loving woman. She operates a tailoring shop, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a cool dry area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of clothing material. 

She will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy fabric to make clothes for selling. Her business goal is to expand her business and have ten employees within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have built her own business premises.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years old and single with two school-going children. She runs a food business  and has been in business for three years earning Ksh 20,000 monthly. 

This is Hellen’s second loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice and baking flour for her business.

She plans to plough the anticipated extra profit back into her business. Her dream is to manage her business well and she hopes to open a boutique shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and baking flour for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four doors and four window frames

loans.name: Muthame

texts.en:
Muthame is a married man with one child. He lives in Tiribe, Mombasa where he works welding metals to support his family. 

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan because he wants to strengthen his business more each time. He plans to use this loan to bulk buy metals for welding. He can buy them at a much better price than usual because with his Kiva loan, he has the capacity to buy wholesale. This will make the investment successful, and this is why he’ll be very competitive when he sells the products and will earn more each time.

loans.use: to buy metals.

loans.name: Philys

texts.en:
Philys is a 52-year-old single woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 to 26 years. She describes herself as an aggressive and self-driven woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, kale, peas, cabbages etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located along a highway with potential customers and her primary customers are passengers and residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of vegetables.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables, that is tomatoes and onions. Her business goal is to be a supplier of tomatoes to major towns with the help of a lorry which she looks forward to buying within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 27 years of age and not yet married. He owns a retail shop and has been in operation for one and half years earning a monthly income of KES 7,900. 

This is his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to purchase sugar, maize flour and rice for resale. With the anticipated profits he plans to plough it back into business and save some for future use. 

His dreams and hopes are that his business prospers so that he can open other retail shops in his home town, he also hopes to start his family soon.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, maize flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been able to develop a poultry business, thanks to his previous Yehu loans with which he bought supplies in large quantities. Currently he is applying for a new Kiva loan which he will use to buy poultry chicks and chicken feed expecting an increase in production. He can benefit from buying them with cash and in larger quantities than usual. 

He sends the following message to the Kiva backers: "I am very grateful for the financing of my project since you have given me the opportunity to increase my production and my income."

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Enma Eutorgia

texts.es: Enma vive en Portoviejo ciudad conocida por su excelente gastronomía. Tiene 58 años y está felizmente casada con Manuel quien vende refrescos por las calles de la ciudad. Hace 6 años que Enma se dedica a la venta de bisutería, comenzó el negocio por que deseaba tener ingresos propios, de este negocio la mayor ventaja es que no tiene que dar créditos ya que si le gusta al cliente paga de inmediato. La atención la realiza sola a cualquier hora del día, entre sus productos ella oferta moños, pinchos de cabello, diadema, lazos, cintas decorativas, anillos de acero etc., vendiendo por unidad o docenas. Uno de los más grandes sueños de Enma es incrementar sus ventas para poder ampliar su negocio es por eso que a solicita el crédito esperando comprar la mercadería que le ayude alcanzarlo.
texts.en: Enma lives in Portoviejo, a city which is well known for its excellent cuisine.  She is 58 years old and happily married to Manuel who sells soft drinks in the city streets.  Enma has been selling costume jewelry for six years.  She started the business because she wanted to make her own income.  The biggest advantage that she has in this business is that she doesn't have to offer credit because if her customers like something they pay straight away.  She serves her customers at any hour of the day.  Among the products she sells are scrunchies, hair pins, hair bands, bows, decorative ribbons, steel rings, etc.  She sells these items individually or by the dozen.  One of Enma's biggest dreams is to increase her sales so that she can expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise that will help her to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to buy scrunchies, hair pins, hair bands, bows, decorative ribbons and steel rings

loans.name: Darwin Marcelo

texts.es: Darwin vive en Picoaza comuna que queda en la ciudad de Portoviejo muy conocida por ser un sector cafetero. El negocio que tiene es la venta de artículos para el hogar, lo empezó hace varios años por un tío a quien le ayudaba con las ventas ganando comisiones, tenían varios sectores por donde ofertaban los productos. En la actualidad tiene 36 años y trabaja solo de manera independiente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde ofertando parlantes, radios y audífonos de puerta a puerta. Con el crédito que está solicitando espera poder comprar más mercaderías para tener en stock.
