El sueño de Darwin es poder terminar su casa y tener un negocio estable y así poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Darwin lives in Picoaza, a community that is in the city of Portoviejo well known for being a coffee area. The business that he has is selling articles for the home. He began it many years ago through an uncle who helped him with sales by earning commissions. They had various areas where they offered the products. Currently, he is 36 years old and works independently only from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening offering speakers, radios and headphones door to door. With the loan that he is requesting, he hopes to be able to buy more merchandise to keep in stock. Darwin's dream is to be able to finish his house and to have a stable business and therefore be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to offer speakers, radios and headphones.

loans.name: Las Babys Group

texts.es:
GRUPO LAS BABYS ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO, DE CREDITUYO SON 6 INTEGRANTES SUS NOMBRES SON.
ALMA,GLORIA,GRACIELA,MARIA,OLGA,Y SOCORRO ELLAS SON AMIGAS Y VECINAS DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS.
MARIA ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES TIENE 28 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON SU PAREJA,Y TIENEN 2 HIJOS DE 8 Y 2 AÑOS ELLOS SON EL MOTOR DE SU VIDA, POR ESO TRABAJA PARA QUE A SUS HIJOS NO LES FALTE NADA.
MARIA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ABARROTES, Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA VENDE TAMALES ENTRES SUS VECINAS Y AMIGAS.
MARIA PIENSA UTILIZAR SU CREDITO, EN SURTIR MAS MERCANCIA PARA SU TIENDA Y ASI TENER MUY BIEN SURTIDO SU NEGOCIO.
A MARIA EN UN FUTURO LE GUSTARIA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO LLEGAR A TENER LA TIENDA MAS GRANDE DE SU COLONIA.
texts.en:
The Credituyo solidarity group, Grupos Las Babys, has six members whose names are Alma, Gloria, Graciela, Maria, Olga, and Socorro.  They have been friends and neighbors for more than ten years.  

Maria is one of the members.  She is 28 years old and lives in a common-law-marriage with the partner.  They have two children who are 2 and 8 years old.  They are her main motivation in life, and she works hard so that her children have everything they need.  

Maria has a grocery store and on weekends, she sells tamales to her friends and neighbors.  Maria plans to use this loan to purchase merchandise for her store so that it will be very well stocked.  In the future, Maria would like to expand her business and have the largest store in her district.

loans.use: to stock more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is thirty-two years old and married to Esther. They are blessed with two children. He runs a restaurant business, He has been in this business for three years earning a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be his second loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use it for purchasing food stock like rice and sugar to be used in the restaurant.

He hopes to use the anticipated profit to purchase more furniture for the restaurant. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase food stock like rice and sugar.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius  is a 55-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 15 years to 27 years. He describes himself to be focused, calm and a visionary man. He operates a retail store  where he sells items such as doors, windows, chairs, tables, door frames, etc. He has been involved in this business for 13 years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a hot dry business environment  and his primary customers are local residents. 

Pius describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of metal. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a welding machine. His business goal is to improve his business and employ eight more people  within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with profits he will have got from the business.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a married man and has two children, both of whom are adults. He resides at his own house with access to electricity and piped water. His monthly expenses include food and expenses for the family.
 
For the past two years, Johnson has operated a meat goat selling business and supplying of milk to his neighborhood. Johnson has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more goats for resale. Johnson sells milk to all categories of people and works six days a week. His major business challenges include seasonality and market price fluctuation. Johnson hopes to see his business expand to being a wholesaler of goats for meat in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Segundo Kleber

texts.es:
A sus 28 años, Segundo reside en la ciudad de Latacunga. Latacunga es capital del la provincia del Cotopaxi que está en la Sierra Central del Ecuador. Latacunga cuenta con un clima templado y una temperatura promedio de 12°C. Latacunga está ubicada en las faldas del volcán activo más alto del mundo, el Cotopaxi, y ha sido destruida 3 veces por las erupciones del mismo de la fundación de la ciudad. Latacunga es conocida por su arquitectura colonial y su bello paisaje de la cordillera de los andes. 

Hace 5 años, Segundo empezó su negocio de reconstrucción de carrocería. Este joven emprendedor aun no tiene su propia familia, por lo tanto dedica varias horas de su tiempo a sacar adelante su negocio. Segundo solicita un crédito a Kiva a través de Fundación Alternativa para la compra de material prima como pintura automotriz, masilla plástica y renovación de herramientas menores para enderezada y pintura y de esta manera incrementar los ingresos. Por el momento tiene mucho competencia y sus ingresos no le son suficientes, pero tiene fe de que este crédito le va a ayudar a salir adelante y brindarle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Segundo is 28 years old and lives in the city of Latacunga.  Latacunga is the capital of the Cotopaxi province which is located in the Sierra Central in Ecuador.  Latacunga has a temperate climate and an average temperature of 12°C (54°F).  Latacunga is located in the foothills of the Cotopaxi volcano, one of the tallest active volcanoes in the world.  It has been destroyed three times by volcanic eruptions since the foundation of the city.  Latacunga is known for its colonial architecture and its beautiful view of the Andes mountains.  

Five years ago, Segundo started his business rebuilding car bodies.  This young entrepreneur does not have a family, so he is able to dedicate many hours to improving his business.  Segundo is asking for this loan from Kiva through Fundación Alternativa to purchase materials such as automobile paint, plastic putty, and to repair small tools used for straightening and painting.  This will help him increase his income.  Currently he is very skilled, but his income is not sufficient, so he has faith that this loan will help him get ahead and provide him with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as automobile paint, plastic putty, and to repair small tools for straightening and painting.

loans.name: Marianela Katherine

texts.es: Marianela es una mujer de 37 años emprendedora y seguidora de sus ideales, viven en Portoviejo con sus padres donde maneja una tienda de abarrotes. Inicio su negocio hace 4 años con un dinero que presto para poder financiar la apertura de su negocio. Atiende desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche ya que es en su domicilio donde está ubicado el local, esto le da la ventaja de no tener que trasladarse a altas horas resultando peligroso. A Marianela su negocio le ha llenado de mucha satisfacción ya que es independiente y sobre todo ha podido ayudar a sus padres con la económica del hogar. Con el préstamo que está solicitando Marianela desea comprar productos para la venta como arroz, azúcar, afrechillo, enlatados, harinas etc. A futuro le gustaría poder formar una familia y tener un negocio más surtido para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marianela is a 37 year old woman who is an entrepreneur and follower of her ideals. She lives in Portoviejo with her parents where she manages a grocery store. She began her business four years ago with money she borrowed to be able to finance the opening of her business. She attends it from 6 in the morning until 7 at night since it is in her house where her shop is located. This gives her an advantage to not have to transport herself at late hours which is dangerous. The business has given Marianela a lot of satisfaction since she is independent and, above all, she has been able to help her parents with home expenses. With the loan that she is requesting, Marianela wishes to buy products to sell like rice, sugar, bran, canned goods, flour, etc. In the future, she would like to be able to have a family and have a business that is better stocked to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bran, canned goods, and flour.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is thirty-eight years old with four children. She runs a clothes  business. She has been in this business for thirteen years, earning monthly income of seven thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase more stock of shirts and skirts for sale.

She plans to use the anticipated profit for expanding the business. She dreams of having a wholesale business for second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of shirts and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.en: Amonullo is a purposeful person. He always tries to realize his plans. He works as a taxi driver but he is going to organize a new business. This business will be the mainstay of his income. He is going to be busy with a food market. He will sell all necessary things for people such as cake, cookies, chocolate, eggs and other products. He will be the perfect business man because he is clever and persevering. He is married to a beautiful woman. They have a child and love him very much. He wants to begin the developing business and you are the only one who can help him. He is asking for a loan to buy goods for organizing this new business. Amonullo awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy goods such as cake, cookies, chocolate, eggs and other products for organizing a new business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Luz Marina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de la Artesanía, principalmente a la confección de tejidos como chompas, bufandas guantes etc. Luz Marina en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar materiales como lanas e hilos para la producción de sus tejidos.
Luz Marina está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the Los Lideres community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues working at her handicraft business, mostly making knitted items such as sweaters, scarves, gloves, and other items.  Luz Marina will use this loan to purchase materials such as wool and thread to make her knits.  

Luz Marina is very happy that Kiva allows her to give her family a better quality of life and to help her with the growth and strengthening of their activities.  She is thankful for this loan and promises to make her payments on time according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wool and thread.

loans.name: Voya

texts.en:
Voya is a father of four children. He lives in Tiribe, Kenya, and has operated a business of selling poultry to restaurant operators. Voya's business has allowed him to get ahead, to expand his business, and to earn enough income to have some comforts. His goal is to expand his business more so that his children can obtain a good quality education and be successful in whatever they endeavor. 

Voya is currently planning to take out his first credit with Kiva, which will be his second funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy poultry chicks and chicken feed for resale. He generates good profits when he buys in bulk, which is what he plans to do in this instance.

loans.use: to buy poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Namunyak

texts.en:
Namunyak is fifty-four years old and widowed with four children. She runs a tea leaves retail  business. She has been in this business for three years,  earning a monthly income of four thousand and three hundred shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase more stock of tea leaves for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to add more stock and expand the business. 


She hopes and dreams to have a business wholesaling tea leaves.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackelin tiene 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable. Su pareja es Justo, el padre de su hija Estefani, de un añito, quien es su inspiración. Juntos, viven en la casa que le heredó el padre de su pareja.

Ella tiene un consultorio odontológico, pues es odontóloga de profesión y quiso tener su propio negocio y ser independiente. Lo viene realizando en su misma vivienda, en un espacio que implementó desde hace 3 años. Al mismo tiempo, cuenta con una botica donde vende los medicamentos necesarios para los tratamientos dentales. Cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja en la atención por las tardes. Su consultorio es muy concurrido, por la calidad de servicio que brinda y así puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenían muchos problemas económicos, pues con las ganancias de su esposo no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos. Por eso desea continuar e implementar su local para que pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes.

Este es su préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP, por ello espera concretar sus planes. Además dice estar cómoda con su grupo, pues considera a sus miembros personas responsables.
De los 2000 nuevos soles solicitados, invertirá 500 en la compra de medicamentos, con el saldo adquirirá la silicona para realizar las prótesis dentales.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 30 years old.  She is a hard-working, tenacious woman who is also cheerful and friendly.  Her partner, Justo, is the father of her daughter, 1-year-old Estefani, who is her inspiration.  The family live together in a house that her partner's father gave them.

Jackeline has a dental office.  She is a dentist by profession and she wanted to have her own business and work for herself.  Her office is located in her home, in a space that she equipped for the purpose three years ago.  She also has a pharmacy where she sells medicines which are necessary for dental treatments.  Her partner helps her serve in this business in the afternoons.  Jackeline's dental office is very busy owing to the quality of service she provides and this enables her to help her partner with their household expenses.  Before she started out in this business, Jackeline had a lot of financial problems because her partner's earnings were not enough to cover their expenses.  For this reason, she would like to continue in her business and equip her premises so that she can serve her clients more comfortably.

This is Jackeline's seventh loan from MFP and she hopes to fulfill her plans.  She says that she is comfortable with her group because she considers the members to be responsible people.

Jackeline will invest 500 soles of the 2,000 soles she has requested in buying medicines and will use the remainder to buy silicone for making dentures.

loans.use: to buy dental medicines and silicone for making dentures

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, además de jovial y sociable. Está separada del padre de sus tres hijos. Actualmente vive con sus hijos y su nuera.
Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y otros comestibles. Para eso cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Empezó hace más de 10 años con un capital propio, viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta, pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su casa, atender a sus hijos y el tiempo libre lo pueda emplear en otras actividades. Por otro lado, no le gusta cuando le solicitan crédito, pues ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de venta, por lo que todas sus ventas son al contando y así puede ver más rápido su ganancia. Tienen planes de implementar más su negocio y así seguir creciendo.

Este es su préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por lo que espera concretar sus planes. Por tanto, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes (arroz, aceites, azúcar y otros), en mayor volumen, y al por mayor.
texts.en:
Maura is 50 years old and is a very hard working and earnest woman; She is jovial and sociable. She is separated from her three children's father. She now lives with her children and daughter in law. 

Her business is in the sale of basic groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, oils and other foods. She has a store in her house for this work. She began more than 10 years ago with her own capital, seeing the necessity of having an additional income and she works it by herself. She likes it because it allows her to be in the comfort of her house, care for her children and in her free time, do other work. On the other hand she does not like it when her customers request to pay on credit because she has had bad experiences with this type of sale. Because of this, all her sales are made on the spot so she can quickly see her earnings. She has plans to expand her business and continue growing. 

This is her fifth loan with the MFP institution, with which she hopes to solidify her plans. She is therefore committed to fulfilling her payments. With the amount requested of 2500 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of more groceries (rice, oils, sugar and others) at wholesale and in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, oil, etc) for her grocery store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun is 35 years old and married with a single child attending school. She permanently lives with her spouse and child in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Being a hardworking mother, Bun aims to pursue a standard of living and obtain a quality of life. She has been a farmer for many years and she also operates a general store to add to her main income. From her hard work, she is able to make approximately USD 15.00 per day, from which she can cover her household expenses and save for future emergencies of the family.

In this coming season, Bun will start growing her potato plants on around two hectares of farmland but she has insufficient funds for that. With regard to her situation, she has applied for a loan in the amount of USD 1,100 to purchase potatoes, fertilizers, and pay labor costs. With the loan's help, Bun will be able to work out her plans and attain her goal. She hopes to send her child to a good college after he finishes at high school level.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, fertilizers, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is fifty-two years old and married with two children. She runs a fish business, which she has been in for nineteen years, earning a monthly income of eight thousand three hundred shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to purchase more stock of fish for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand the business.


Her hopes and dreams in future are to grow her business and  sell fish wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fish for sale

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her bleach selling business. With the loan investment she will buy bleach in larger quantity that will help her filling larger orders on time and increase her sales and income. She will also buy plastic bottles in large numbers for packaging. She is a very confident lady and has a large number of business contacts. She works with her husband who is responsible for product delivery and taking orders from the market.

Zahida has been operating her business for many years and is confident that her business will get more success after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Zahida.

loans.use: To buy bleach and plastic bottles for bleach selling business

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Pilar

texts.es: Cleotilde de 42 años vive en el sector sur urbano de Guayaquil conocido como Isla Trinitaria, este sector fue fundado por personas que al no tener los recursos invadieron esta zona la cual estaba deshabitada, hoy en día es uno de los sectores más populares y en constante crecimiento. Es aquí donde vive Cleotilde una mujer luchadora que ha sacado adelante a sus 6 hijos siendo madre soltera. El negocio que tiene es de venta de reciclaje, empezó hace 10 años luego de que la despidieran de su trabajo como conserje en una escuela pública, opto por este tipo de negocio porque le permitía cuidar de sus hijos y manejar su tiempo. Comenta que este  es rentable y lo que más se utiliza es el material humano lo que minora considerablemente sus costos. Con el tiempo que a tenido en el negocio pudo reunir el capital suficiente para comprar varios triciclos lo cuales presta a otras personas quienes realizan el labor, ella es más una intermediaría ya que les compra el reciclaje por peso y luego los vende a las grandes procesadoras. El negocio de Cleotilde ha aumentado considerablemente en los últimos años gracias a la campaña del Gobierno por un país ecológico. El crédito que está solicitando es para poder capitalizarse y seguirle comprando el material reciclado a sus proveedores. Espera en un futuro poder comprar un camión para movilizarse mejor en su negocio.
texts.en:
42-year-old Cleotilde lives in the southern sector of Guayaquil known as Isla Trinitaria. This area was founded by people lacking resources, who settled in the uninhabited area. Today it is one of the most popular areas and is constantly growing. This is where Cleotilde lives. She is a fighter, and has raised her six children as a single mother. 

Cleotilde has a recycling business, which she started 10 years ago after she left her job as a janitor in a public school. She chose this type of work because it allows her to take care of her children and manage her time. She says that it is cost effective and she uses mostly human material which considerably reduces her costs. In the time that she has had her business, she has been able to raise enough capital to buy several tricycles which she lends to others who do the work, as she is more of an intermediary and buys the recycling by weight and then sells it on to larger processors. 

Cleotilde's business has grown considerably in recent years thanks to the government's campaign for a greener country. The loan she is requesting will be used to capitalize and to continue to buy recycled material from her suppliers. In the future, she hopes to buy a truck to make her business more mobile.

loans.use: purchase recycles materials

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La socia Rosa nació en la provincia de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 44 años de edad y está divorciada pero tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella trabaja como ama de llaves desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 3:30 de la tarde de lunes a sábado. Ella también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Rosa requiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes, pinta labios, delineadores, collares, aretes y otros más. La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member, Rosa, was born in the province of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is 44 years old and is divorced with two children. Rosa belongs to the community bank  “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” and is doing very well thanks to the timely payment of her dues. 

Rosa works as a housekeeper from 6 am to 3:30 pm Monday through Saturday. She also sells beauty products and has had this business for several years, which is doing very well. This time, Rosa requires a loan to buy perfumes, lipsticks, eyeliners, necklaces, earrings and other items. She is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lipsticks, eyeliners, necklaces, earrings and other items.

loans.name: Kule

texts.en:
Kule is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her business. She operates a meat goat business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She supplies to each customer according to what is ordered from her. 

She started working as a merchant two years ago. As she wants to continually improve her businesses, her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her businesses' turnover increases. This is why she has sought out a Kiva loan through her first financing experience with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it, she will buy more goats for resale.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar operates a grocery store adjacent to her home. She sells different grocery items such as cooking oils, spices, snacks, etc. at very reasonable rates to her clients.

Her husband is a daily wage laborer and works very hard to support the family.

Sarwar has given birth to four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is married, while the others are yet to be married.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her business. With the loan investment, she will put a larger stock of groceries at her shop to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: For the past 10 years, Rakia has sold panties and utensils at Apowa near Takoradi. She is divorced and has 4 children. Rakia will use the loan to purchase additional stock for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rakia plans to support her business and her children.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her business

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: For the past four years, Agartha has operated a bar at Apowa near Takoradi. She is married to a driver and has 3 children. Agartha will use the loan to purchase stock for her bar. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agartha plans to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her bar

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a seamstress who makes panties. She has been selling them at Apowa near Takoradi for the past 12 years. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works at a harbor. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase material and stocks for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase material and stock

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina pastes jewels on clothes. She receives orders from her clients and fulfills those orders to share the financial burden with her husband. Her work is very neat and admired by her clients.

Her husband is an electrician who repairs electrical appliances.

Robina has two sons. Her eldest left school after the 5th grade, while her youngest has started his education this year.

Robina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business and with the loan she will buy clothes and jewels to improve her business further.

loans.use: To buy jewels and clothes for her clothing-decorating business.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana sells fish at Apowa near Takoradi, which she has been doing for seven years. She is married to a driver and has four children. 

Her loan will be used to buy fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her business and family.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Vat

texts.en:
Vat, aged 36, appears in the photo with his spouse. They are residents of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Together they have three children, all of whom are still dependents and attending school. As the head of his family, Vat has big responsibilities: to raise his children in good living conditions and to provide them with a good education. He has a farming business, earning just enough to provide for their daily sustenance. For additional income, Vat has been a paid worker in one industry in Siem Reap where he can earn approximately USD 5 per day.

To make improvements to his farming business, Vat would like to request some funds from the generous lenders who always help low-income families to better their income. The purpose of his loan is to purchase fertilizers and to pay for plowing fees. The funds provided by lenders will be a great help in maintaining his farm work and improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married, and she lives in her own house in Tiribe, Mombasa. She lives with her husband and child, who is still too young for school.

Mejumaa raises hens. She tells us that she has been doing this work for some time, so she has a well-formed client base. She is a woman who is hardworking and enterprising, a fighter. She has always worked, and she is not afraid to take on a challenge. She says that, thanks to her husband's help and her work, she is getting ahead with a lot of effort and sacrifice.

Mejumaa is seeking a loan to purchase additional hens to raise in her coop so that she can increase her income and attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hens to raise and then sell

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh, aged 34, is the mother of two teenaged children. The family are long-time residents of the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. Kheng, her husband as well as her business partner, is very supportive of her farming business. To earn a better living, they strive to work hard in the field to provide good growth to their crops, which will pay off in the coming harvesting season. The couple has been engaged in this business for many years. 

Due to a shortage of capital, Lanh wants to acquire a loan to invest in her business. She is requesting a loan through HKL to hire some workers to help transplant her rice. She expects that this loan will make an improvement in her income.

loans.use: to hire some workers to help transplant her rice.

loans.name: Roiser

texts.es:
Roiser tiene 42 años, es un hombre muy generoso, amable y trabajador. Está casado con Reyna, la madre de sus tres hijos. Ambos trabajan mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de pescado fresco. Su actividad empieza desde muy temprano, al dirigirse al puerto en busca del pescado fresco de todas las variedades y calidad. Luego lo vende como ambulante, en un triciclo, llevándolo por diversos asentamientos humanos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 10 años y lo considera rentable, pues el precio del pescado está al alza y le deja buenas ganancias. Se siente muy bien con su negocio, ya que cuenta con un oficio y siempre tiene clientes a quienes atiende con una sonrisa y un trato muy amigable. Tiene planes de seguir trabajando para hacer crecer cada día más su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y está muy contento de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero, ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquilo. Por su parte, está comprometido en seguir siendo un socio puntual en sus cuotas, así como lo fue en los anteriores créditos. Y además está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más pescado, en mayores cantidades, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Roiser, 42, is a very generous, kind and hard-working man. He is married to Reyna, the mother of his three children. They both work hard to be able to provide their family with a better quality of life.

He sells fresh fish for a living. His work starts very early in the morning, he goes to the port to source fresh fish of various types and qualities. Then he sells them as a travelling salesman, from his tricycle, in various squats. He is been working in this field for more than 10 years and considers it to be very profitable, since the price of fish is rising and it provides a good income. He is very happy with his business, since he has a trade and always has customers, who he assists with a smile and a friendly attitude. He plans to keep working so that his business can grow every day.

This is his sixth loan from MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support as it gives him a guarantee that he can continue working without stress. For his part, he is committed to continuing to be punctual in his payments, as he was during his previous loan commitments. He is also very happy to belong to his communal bank as all of its members are very responsible and caring.

With the requested sum of 1000 nuevos soles, he will invest in the purchase of more fish and in greater quantities as he is looking to get lower cost prices by buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy more fish in greater quantities in order to continue selling.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 49-year-old lady who lives in the Al-Am'ari refugee camp in Ramallah. She has three sons and two daughters, two of whom are married. She lives with two sons and a daughter, along with her husband.

Nidal has a salon in her home, and she has 20 years experience.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy two chairs, one for cutting hair and the other for hair washing.

Her ambition is to have a big salon, improve her income and increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy two chairs, one for cutting hair and the other for hair washing

loans.name: Zuhdi

texts.en:
Zuhdi is a 23-year-old single young man. His father works in agriculture, and his brother is a worker, but their income is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay for his education expenses. 

Zuhdi is studying at the university, specializing in finance. Zuhdi wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the fees. This will ensure a better future for Zuhdi and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay the university education cost

loans.name: Duku

texts.en:
Duku is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in Tiribe, Kenya. Duku is very enterprising. From her savings, she set up a clothing shop. She has been renting a unit in the market for the past year.

She says that when she started out, it was difficult because of the competition that existed, but with a great deal of sacrifice she established her clientele, including by selling in the street. She then managed to sell wholesale and is very successful. Her dream is to work on a large scale, and this is what she is fighting for.

She is requesting a loan to buy trousers, T-shirts, dresses, sneakers, shoes and other items, which she will stock in order to offer a wide variety to her clients.

loans.use: to buy trousers, T-shirts, dresses, sneakers, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi and her spouse live in their own house in Tiribe, Mombasa. They have ten children who all attend school and are dependent on them. 

Umazi is a very self-sacrificing person. She tells us that she has farmed for years, growing all kinds of vegetables to sell. At the same time, she raises livestock and buys goats to sell for slaughter in order to increase her profits. Thanks to her years of work and effort, she can now provide her family a comfortable home with the necessary conveniences.

Umazi is applying for a loan to buy animals for slaughter, as there is lot of demand at this time of year. She is very happy about the opportunity she is receiving through Yehu Microfinance and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell for slaughter.

loans.name: Patrina

texts.en: Patrina sells underwear, sandals, and bags at Apowa near Takoradi, which she has done for 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is self-employed. Patrina will use the loan to purchase stock for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patrina plans to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her business.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Orn is a 41-year-old married mother of four children who all are in school. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income which she has been in for two years. Lack of capital is still the main challenge for her business. Orn is able to earn about KHR 24,500 per day from current business. 

This is the first microloan for her group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of two female members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Orn will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and also use a portion of it to spend for plowing her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a good living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia sells dresses and beverages at Apowa near Takoradi. She is single and has 2 children. Sophia has been operating her business for 16 years. Her loan will be used to buy drinks and materials for her dress-making business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her children.

loans.use: to buy drinks and materials for her dress-making business.

loans.name: Delia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Delia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se dedica al negocio de la Artesanía, principalmente a la confección de tejidos como chompas, bufandas guantes etc. y con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia. Delia  invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar materiales como lanas e hilos para la producción de sus tejidos.
Delia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Delia, she belongs to the communal bank "Los Lideres" from the city of Cusco, Peru. 

Our member has a crafts business, mainly sewing knitwear such as sweaters, scarves, gloves etc. and this is how she supports her family. 

Delia will invest the requested loan in the purchase of materials such as wool and threads, which she needs to make her knitwear.

Delia is very grateful to KIVA for helping her to give her family a better quality of life and helping her to grow and strengthen her business.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy material like wool and thread.

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda is 46 years old. She has four children and still has one daughter to take care of. Her child is still in school. She is a rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Fish selling is the main source of the family’s income. She can earn about KHR 46,700 per day from her current business. 

Chanda’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other members have been with them from three to four cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her earn a better living. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Chanda will use her portion to buy more fish to sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to make the business grow so as to improve the family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her young sister. 

She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for this loan of 300000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. Besides this salon business she generates additional income through hiring out her Motorcycle. She works from her home and works on retail basis.  

Her major business challenges include transportation and the increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Andrea Solange

texts.es: Andrea vive en el sector sur conocido como Isla Trinitaria donde tiene su domicilio. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos  y ropa, empezó por que le gustaba lo que es maquillaje y compraba muchos cosméticos así que decidió ser proveedora en vez de consumidora. Lleva varios años en el negocio y le va muy bien, sus mayores clientes son los familiares, vecinos y compañeros de universidad. El trabajo lo realiza sola de lunes a domingo sin horario ya que su esposo es comerciante y conoce la forma del trabajo. Entre sus productos vende blusas las cuales compra a $ 15.00 y vende a $ 27.00 interiores de marcas reconocidas de $17.00 a $25.00 y cosméticos por catálogos. El préstamo lo empleara para capitalizarse  y comprar mercadería. Su sueño a futuro es poder comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Andrea lives in the southern zone, known as Isla Trinitaria. She sells cosmetics and clothes and started because she liked make-up and bought lots of cosmetics so she decided to be a provider instead of a consumer. 

She has been running this business for several years and it is going very well, her main customers are relatives, neighbours and her university colleagues. She works Monday - Sunday and does not keep a specific timetable as her husband is a salesperson and understands the trade.

Amongst her products, she sells blouses, which she buys for $15 and sells for $27, underwear from recognised brands, which she buys at $17 and sells at $25 and cosmetics from catalogues. 

She will use the loan to capitalise and buy merchandise. Her dream for the future is to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy blouses and underwear

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El socio Francisco nació en el departamento de Apurímac pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 57 años de edad y tiene cinco hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la venta de pasamanería y artefactos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Francisco requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ollas, radios, Dvd y otras cosas más.  El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member, Franciso, was born in the Department of Apurimac but he lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 57 years old and has five children. He belongs to “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” Communal Bank and is doing very well thanks to his prompt repayment of loans. He sells accessories and devices and has been engaged in this business for several years.  He has been doing very well. At this time, Francisco needs a loan to purchase merchandise, such as pots, radios, DVDs and other items. He is grateful for the loan and promises to make all of his payments according to the established time table.

.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pots, radios, DVDs and other items.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Koul District of Battambang Province, Cambodia, Sim is age 53 and married. She is the mother of two daughters, both of whom are still her dependents and in school. To make a living, Sim has been working as a vegetable seller at the market in her local area for four years. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business.
Sim’s Group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and have completely paid back the past loans. The past loans have helped her to make a better living. Now, Sim is leading her group to request a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more vegetables to sell and to pay for a rented market stall. She hopes to earn more income in order to expand her current business and to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell and to pay for a rented market stall.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Korn is 62 and widowed. She has four children. To earn a living, she has been in rice farming and bean planting for almost 40 years and she supplements her income by fishing to support the family. The main challenge for her is low crop yields destroyed by flood. She is able to earn about 66,400 KHR per day to meet family’s need and can manage to save about 22,900 KHR each day. 

This is Korn’s first cycle with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR with VisionFund. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds, a water pump for her farmland and also use a portion of it to buy a boat. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family's income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and a water pump for her farmland

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Ny is a 53-year-old mother of four children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. Cassava planting on 1.5 hectares has been the family's only source of income for almost thirty years. The main challenge for her business is the low price received for the crop yield. The current business earns her about KHR 29,200 per day.

Ny has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for three cycles, and she successfully paid back the previous loans, which have helped her better support her family and keep her children in school. Now she is applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 through VisionFund. Ny will use this new loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor. She hopes to sell her cassava at a good price so she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia sells rubber goods at Apowa near Takoradi. She is married to a driver and has 3 children. Cecilia has been selling rubber goods for 4 years. Her loan will be used to buy stock for her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her family.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business

loans.name: Marlind

texts.en:
Marlind is 34 years old and married. Not long ago, his father passed away and he had been grieving ever since. However, the birth of his little girl just three weeks ago has filled him with some joy and lifted his spirits a bit.

Marlind has been in the livestock industry for the past three years, selling milk to a dairy farm in a neighboring village. According to Marlind, the business has been going well. He is now planning to take advantage of the reduced price for a cow that his neighbor, who is going to Italy soon, is selling. 

Marlind feels that he has to grow his business because he is the only one financially supporting his mother, wife, and child. He is convinced that he cannot do this without the support of Kiva lenders. His promise to lenders is that he will pay back the loan on time and in full.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Pliscah

texts.en:
Pliscah is 30 years old and married to Wainaina. She is from Naivasha and has one daughter who is six months old.
Pliscah has a retail shop that she has been running for the past year. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy soap, soft drinks, and cooking oil to add to her stock.
She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy soap, soft drinks, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ilirjan

texts.en:
Ilirjan is 56, married and has three children ranging in age from 20 to 26 years old. The children attend universities and Ilirjan has been the only one to pay for their tuition fees. “It’s been very difficult,” Ilirjan says, "yet I have had no other choice but to help them finish off their education successfully.”

For the past 9 years, Ilirjan has been operating a grocery store and throughout the years he has been able to establish and nurture a steady clientele that seems to be growing. "This makes me happy,” he says beaming.  Kindly note that he worked in the coal mining industry until 9 years ago. 

At this point, he is requesting a loan to renovate the store. It is not his first loan; it’s the fifth, yet he has paid the previous ones on time. Being associated with VFA for a long time, Ilirjan has showed the trait of responsibility in his character.

loans.use: To renovate the grocery store

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sok is 54 years old and married with seven children, only three of whom are still in school. The primary source of her family’s income is rice farming on 1.8 hectares of farmland. She and her husband have been in this business for 32 years. Currently, the business earns them approximately USD 8 per day, of which they are able to save USD 4 per day.

Sok has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan. The previous loan helped her afford sufficient foods, improve her livelihood, and keep her children in school. Now she is requesting a loan of USD 500 through VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and to pay for gasoline and plowing. She hopes to increase her crop yields in order to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and to pay for gasoline and plowing

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is married with five children, all of whom go to school  She also takes care of additional family members (her nephew and niece). She has a food stall where she sells bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for seven years. Eva sells to all categories of people on both retail and wholesale terms, and she works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Eva has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. In addition to the banana business, she generates additional income by serving as a Nakawa division councilor for which she receives an allowance every month. She resides in the family house, which has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is 55 years old and from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her oldest is 30 and her youngest is 19 years old. Rufina needs a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for labor for her farming. An investment in her farming will be an assurance that her family can eat properly and reinvest in the same business in the future. Rufina will continue to improve her business so she can help sustain the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pay for labor

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng is 58 years old and a single parent who is responsible for two children. She is a resident living with her older sister, her children, and a grandchild in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Heng is a conscientious farmer, who works very hard to cover her household needs. She has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years, earning an average of 11,300 KHR per day. Despite her hardship and patience, Heng wants to provide her children a better living standard.

With the requested amount, Heng would like to use it for building a strong ladder, so it will help secure the family out of danger due to the old, decayed ladder. Heng has been with HKL for two loans already and this will be her third loan used to improve her family. She is very thankful for unending support from lenders.

loans.use: to build a strong ladder.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Khen is 50 years old and married. She has 9 children, 6 of whom are still dependent on her; some work at the family’s business and some are still in school. The main sources of the family's income are from cassava planting on 1.5 hectares and soybean planting on 3 hectares. Khen has been in this business for 5 years. She is able to earn about 30,200 KHR per day from the current business to spend on daily expenses. The low price of cassava in the market and also low crop yield are still the main challenges for her business. Khen supplements her income by working as a paid worker.

Khen has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle and successfully paid back the past loan. She has successfully used the loan to better support her business and family. Now requesting a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR with VisionFund, she is going to use it to buy fertilizers and spend for plowing the farmland. She hopes to earn more income from the business so as to keep her children in school and live a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and spend for plowing the farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pork

texts.en:
Pork is aged 54 and a widowed mother of two children, one of whom (a son) is still dependent on her and helps the family’s business. She lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she has been planting cassava on one hectare of land and raising pigs. She also supplements her income by selling grocery items. She has been in this business for thirty years, earning about 30,800 KHR per day and she can manage to save 18,400 KHR each day. 

Pork received the first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, one cycle ago and completely paid back the past loan, which has relieved her family’s burden. Now she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Salaquiel, con quien tiene dos hijos, de 9 y 2 años de edad. Viven en su casa propia, la compraron con el esfuerzo de ambos. 

Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, pasamanería, fármacos y otros. Para eso, instaló su tienda en un espacio acondicionado en su vivienda. Inició hace más de 2 años con un capital propio y luego fue creciendo con préstamos de MFP. Cuando está fuera de casa cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñada para la atención, a quien también contrata para el cuidado de su menor hijo. Considera que su negocio es rentable, pues tiene una clientela constante, el problema es cuando llueve constantemente, ya que dificulta el libre tránsito malogrando los accesos a su casa y le ventas bajan, pero eso no la desanima.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido, ya que ha encontrado apoyo por parte de todos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda (abarrotes). También comprará dos estantes de vidrio, uno pequeño valorizado en 70 nuevos soles y uno más grande valorizado en 450 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lorena is 41 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is eager to get ahead. She is married to Salaquiel, with whom she has two children who are 9 and 2. They live in their own home, which they bought through their mutual effort.

Lorena’s business is the sale of grocery staples, accessories, medicines and other items. She installed her store in a space set up in her home. She opened it more than two years ago with her own capital and then continued growing through loans from MFP. When she is away from home, she relies on her sister-in-law’s help in waiting on her customers. Lorena also hires her to care for her young son. She considers that her business is profitable since she has a loyal customer base. The problem is when it rains incessantly because it hinders free movement, making access to her home difficult and this causes sales to drop.  However this does not discourage her.

This is her third loan from MFP therefore she expects to continue meeting her objectives. She notes, in addition, that she is comfortable with her communal bank since she considers it to be a united group and she has found the members to be supportive.

She will invest the loan of S/. 2,000 in the purchase of merchandise for her store. She will also buy two glass shelves, a small one valued at S/. 70 and a larger one valued at S/. 450..

loans.use: to purchase two shelves to exhibit the products in her store as well as more merchandise to have in stock.

loans.name: Cheng's Group

texts.en:
Cheng is 32 years old and lives in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia. She is the married mother of two sons, one of whom is still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice for eight years, and she supplements her income by planting red corn. She is able to earn about 9,100 KHR per day. Her main challenge is a lack of capital to support her current business.

Cheng has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other member of her group has been with VisonFund for two cycles. Cheng completely paid back the previous loan, which has helped her to improve her standard of living. She is requesting a new loan from VisionFund as the leader of her group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds and to pay for plowing. She expects to earn more income, which will enable her to improve her living standard and keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells sandals in Apowa near Takoradi, which she has done for two years. She is widowed and has three children. Rebecca will use the loan to purchase stock for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to support her children.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business selling sandals.

loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en: Sadaina is married with four children and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of two grandchildren. She has a business of selling secondhand bed sheets. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used bed sheets. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells to all categories of people at the market, but on a retail basis. She works six days out of every week.  Besides this clothing business she generates additional income through selling used shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. The family resides in a rented house and has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used bed sheets

loans.name: Amani Za Congo Plus Group

texts.en:
Yves is the chairman of the Community Bank, “Amani za Congo Plus”, which is composed of 13 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Yves runs two businesses, a general store and a telephone booth, to the west of Kinshasa. He began them in 2000. His beginning capital was $150. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Yves is now well-known and liked in his area. He makes about US $200 of profit each week. Yves intends with the next loan to purchase more prepaid cards to meet the customers' demand and generate additional profits. 

He is 44 years old, married, and the father of four children aged between two and eight. Two of the children attend school. His ambition is to expand his businesses.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid cards to meet the customers' demand and generate additional profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a 56-year-old widow with two adult children. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol. She is a rice farmer who works hard on her farm so she can help sustain the needs of her household. Susana's challenges includes limited capital for her farming. Because of this, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seedlings for her farm so that she can continue her livelihood. This will be such a great help for her and her family. Whatever income generated will be used for family daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seedlings

loans.name: Eblin  Yaneth

texts.es:
Eblin tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos, y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Eblin tiene una actividad desde hace 12 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas.  Con este negocio Eblin ha podido ayudar a su pareja con los gastos incurridos en el hogar. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora e inteligente, hace diferentes estilos de piñatas y tiene sus propios clientes, trabaja también por encargos.
Ella ha solicitado 2 préstamos a Odef, y actualmente solicita el tercero de 5,000 lempiras para comprar los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las piñatas, como Papel, resistol, prensa etc.
Su meta es terminar un pedido de piñatas y poder obtener el capital necesario para solventar los gastos de estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eblin, age 42, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  She lives in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality.

Eblin has been making and selling piñatas for 12 years.  With this business Eblin has been able to help her life partner with the household expenses.  She is a very enterprising and intelligent person.  She makes different styles of piñatas, and she has her own customers.  She also works by orders.

She has requested two loans from ODEF.  She is currently requesting her third loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy the materials needed to make piñatas.  She will buy things like paper, glue, and newspapers, etc.

Her goal is to finish an order for piñatas.  She will do this in order to get the money needed to pay her children’s educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy materials like tissue paper, glue, and newspapers to make piñatas.

loans.name: Rainera

texts.en:
Rainera is 57 years old and married with five children. Her eldest is 22 years old while her youngest is 8. Rainera is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She finds ways to help her husband, who works in a bakery, by selling Avon cosmetics. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Rainera is asking for a loan to buy additional items from Avon, such as lotion, cologne, body talc, and perfume. Additional capital is just what she needs to improve her business. Any profit will be used for her children's healthy diet and school fees.

loans.use: to buy additional Avon items such as lotion, cologne, body talc, and perfume

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells fish at Apowa near Takoradi. She is married to a driver and has 5 children. Elizabeth has been selling fish for 2 years. Her loan will be used to buy fish for her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fish for her business

loans.name: Or

texts.en:
Or is a responsible mother who has tried hard to earn income to support her family. She is 62 years old and the single parent of five children, one of whom is married. Her business focus is rice farming, which she has done for more than 33 years. Her children also help with the business in order to cut down on operating costs. 

With the coming rainfall, Or and other villagers are busy with farm work. Or wants to have a good harvest this year, but due to a lack of capital she won’t be able to go far in pursuing her goal. Therefore, she has requested a loan to rent a tractor to till her land. She believes that this loan will have a positive impact to her business as well as her living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till her land.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak is 39 years old and he has five children, three daughters and two sons, all of whom are dependent on him and are in school. He is a villager from a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, where rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. He supplements his income by planting cassava on 1.5 hectares of land. He has been in this business for fourteen years. He earns approximately 15,300 KHR per day from the current business but he can manage to save about 11,300 KHR each day.

Lak has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles and successfully paid back the loans, while his group members have been from the first cycle. He is leading the group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Lak is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland and use a portion of it to plant rubber tree seedlings to earn more income. He hopes to increase his income so as to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Pulina

texts.en: Pulina sells secondhand clothes at Apowa near Takoradi, which she has done for two years. Her husband is a driver, and she has four children. Pulina will use the loan to purchase stock for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Pulina plans to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothes for her business

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida is fifty-six years old and married to Richard. Together they have four children who are all adults. She has been in this business for seventeen years, earning a monthly income of seven thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase more stock of fish for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

Her future hope and dream is to be a competent business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish for sale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 20 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. As she has been exposed to life in a remote place, she started rice farming 3 years ago. She is motivated to work hard for her 9-month-old baby. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides for her farm. Once these are available, she can expect better quality crops in 4 months' time. Whatever income that she will generate will be used for savings for the needs of her child, her family's daily consumption, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Theodosia

texts.en: Theodosia sells rice at Apowa, near Takoradi. She is widowed and has 1 child. Theodosia has been selling rice for 10 years. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her business and child.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard is 24 years old. He is married to Janet and together they have one child. He is a charcoal distributor and has been in the business for the past three years.

This Bernard's first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase more inventory of charcoal for stock in his business.

He hopes to one day purchase a plot of land where he can build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy car for starting a taxi business

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en:
Chanry is 36 years old. She has five children (three daughters and two sons), four of whom are still dependent and in school. Chanry lives in a village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She earns a living selling vegetables in a local market. She has been in this business for two years, currently earning about KHR 11,000 per day. A lack of capital to run the business is her main challenge.

Chanry has been with VisionFund for four cycles while her group member has been VisionFund for one cycle. Chanry successfully paid back the previous loans, which have helped her to relieve her family's burden and improve their livelihood. She is leading her group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: For 20 years, Doris has run a chop bar at Apowa near Takoradi. She is divorced and has 7 children. Doris will use the requested loan to purchase ingredients for the food she makes at her chop bar. With the additional profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the food she sells

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: For five years now, Geraldine has been engaged in a rice farming business. She is 27 years old, married, and from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Her husband works as a security guard for the government. She has a five-year-old daughter whom she supports through her income from the farm. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings, and to pay labor fees for hired help. Geraldine's business will greatly help her family in terms of paying for daily food consumption, school fees, and electric bills. In the future, she hopes to have other business options that will give her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings, and to pay labor fees for hired help

loans.name: Luce

texts.en:
Luce is in her fifties, married and a mother of four with the oldest child being twenty nine and the youngest twenty four years old. “All my children turned out to be hard-workers. One of them is an artisan and I love his traditional crafts,” she says proudly. For the past eighteen years she has been selling milk and animals to local buyers and farmers. The business has proved to do well because the demand in the nearby villages is high. They all live in the northwest part of the country where winters are extremely cold and animals die if they don’t stay warm. 

Luce is requesting a Kiva loan at this time to repair her stable, and for this she is seeking lenders’ understanding in this matter. She hopes to get support from them in order to repair the stable before winter starts and animals are at risk.

loans.use: to repair her animals' stable.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old. She is from Naivasha and is married to Titus. They have a son who is five years old and in school.

Esther has a second-hand clothes business that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to add more clothing inventory to her stock.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 38 years old from Nakuru and is married with five children who are aged between seven years and 23 years.

Tabitha has a cereals business that she has been doing for the past five years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy beans, rice, green grams, etc. to add to her stock.

She hopes to buy a lorry in the future to help in transportation of goods.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, and green grams

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. Previously, she used to sell clothes. She has been in the business for four years. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to grow her business. She hopes to operate a wholesale business in the future. She needs a loan of 80,000 KES to buy paraffin, sugar, and rice.

loans.use: to buy paraffin, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en: Ma. Lourdes is 31 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has three children aged 7, 11 and 14. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband in tilling the land while she has another business as a food vendor. Ma. Lourdes is asking a loan to buy flour, banana and cassava. She usually makes deep-fried bananas and steamed cassavas. With the additional capital, Ma. Lourdes will be able to increase her production and earn a good profit. The income generated will provide her family with a healthy diet and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, banana and cassava.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She sells secondhand clothes to make a living. She has been in the business since 2008. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained on business management. She dreams of expanding her business and employ people in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
The member is a salesperson; he buys and sells fish that he collects from the Indian Ocean. He has his own craft where he does his fishing. His products are then sold in Msambweni and to other buyers in different towns.

Juma has a partner, and has two children. His significant other works with him in the fishing industry.

Juma is a very hardworking man with good business references as he has a good return rate on his business. It is also a well-known micro-enterprise in Msambweni. He needs the loan to buy fishing equipment and use what he collects to sell. Juma is committed to meeting his payments on time as well as being responsible with the loan organization.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and tools for fishing

loans.name: Risper

texts.en: Risper is a hardworking business lady who operates a retail shop for a living. She has been in the business since the year 2011. Previously, she used to operate a grocery store. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of opening a wholesale business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and cooking oil

loans.name: 04.11.01.nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hoa is applying for a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. She has a retail business selling vegetables and dry foods.

Hoa is 58 years old and married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 04.11.01 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
Hoa lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province, and two other who are grown up.

In 2011, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid four loans. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business challenges that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With the business profit, Hoa hopes to grow her business and help her children in their studies and jobs.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable and dry food for resale

loans.name: 04.11.03.nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Huyến is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks.

Huyến is 50 years old and is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 04.11.03 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
Huyến lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province, and her other child is grown up.

In 2011, Huyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid two loans. Huyến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main business hardship that Huyến faces is the lack of capital.

In the future, she hopes that her children will find good jobs, her family will be healthy and happy, and her business will do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emelia sells secondhand clothes and provisions at Apowa near Takoradi, which she has done for 20 years. She is widowed and has 3 children. Emelia will use the loan to purchase stock for her business, such as clothes and other provisions. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emelia plans to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and provisions for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells beans and groundnuts at Apowa near Takoradi, and has been doing so for 4 years. She is married to a farmer and has one child. Her loan will be used to buy stock for her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Maira Suyapa

texts.es:
Maira, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos, vive en una aldea cercana que pertenece al municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Maira, es muy trabajadora, ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse al comercio y a la agricultura. Produce y vende café y banano. También vende comida en la escuela que está cerca a su casa. Esta solicitando un préstamo de 5,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante para la finca de café y banano, espera que esta inversión le ayude a  incrementar la producción. Su sueño es trabajar mucho con su finca, darle el mantenimiento adecuado para tener una fuente de ingresos seguro y lograr una independencia económica con su familia.
texts.en:
