Maira, age 35, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  They live in a nearby village in the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality.

Maira is a very hard-worker.  She has been devoting herself to commerce and agriculture for ten years.  She produces and sells coffee and bananas.  She also sells food at the school that is close to her house.

Maira is requesting a loan for 5,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer for her coffee and banana farm.  She hopes that this investment will help her to increase production.  Her dream is to work a lot on her farm, give it adequate maintenance in order to have a secure source of income, and to obtain financial independence with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee and banana farm.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 27 years old. He is married to Alice and together they have three children. He operates a motorcycle parts shop and has been in the business for the past year.

This is his first loan term in KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase spare parts for stock in his business.

He hopes to be financially stable and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El socio Jose Luis nació en el departamento de Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes De Virgen Asunta” y le va muy bien gracias a los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él se dedica a la venta de artesanía y lleva sus productos a diferentes ciudades y en especial al país de Bolivia. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Jose Luis requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo carteras, sombreros, mochilas y otras cosas más.  El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Jose Luis was born in Cusco department and lives in the city in which he was born.  He is 30 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  The couple have two children.  Jose Luis belongs to 'Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta' community bank and he is doing very well because he makes his loan repayments on time.  His business is selling handicrafts.  He takes his products to sell in different cities and in Bolivia.  He has been in this business for many years and it is going very well.

On this occasion, Jose Luis needs a loan to buy merchandise including wallets, hats and backpacks.  He is grateful for his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including wallets, hats and backpacks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fish at Apowa near Takoradi. She is married to a driver and has 4 children. Mary has been selling fish for 4 years. She is responsible for supporting her husband and children. Her loan will be used to buy fish in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells bedsheets at Apowa near Takoradi, Ghana, which she has done for 2 years. She is married to a Guinness employee and has 2 children. Margaret will use the loan to purchase stock for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Twahili

texts.en:
Twahili is from Tiribe, Mombasa, which is in Kenya. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife Mwanalima. He works selling fruits and vegetables in a little shed at the entrance to the city.

With sacrifice and dedication, Twahili has managed to get his four children ahead, with the help of his wife. He is a very hardworking man. He says he always has worked and he is not afraid of challenges. His goal is to be able to continue growing and have a bigger shed to continue helping his family and his wife.

Twahili is coming to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply his business customers with top-quality products.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, onions, and seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es:
La señora María, es socia del banco comunal “Nuevo Edén” del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Hace poco tiempo que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas, su pareja es empleado en un grifo de la ciudad.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 12 paquetes de gaseosas y 10 cajas de cerveza, para implementar su negocio y que no le falte para vender.
De esta manera le ayuda a  su esposo, ha construido una pequeña ramada para poner su negocio en la parte de adelante de su casa y no tener que salir a trabajar a otro sitio y poder estar pendiente de su pequeño que necesita de su atención.
Su esposo está contento porque gracias a su esfuerzo tienen un pequeño negocio propio y lo está manejando muy bien  para que más adelante puedan trabajar juntos,  aun es pequeño pero piensan hacerlo crecer mucho.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Nuevo Edén' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 26 years old, married, and has one child.

María has been working with Manuela Ramos for a short time.  Her business is selling soda and beer.  Her partner works as an employee in a gas station in the city.

María will use this new loan for 1,000 soles to buy 12 packets of soda and 10 crates of beer to stock her business so that she doesn't run out of stock.  In this way, María is able to help her husband.  The couple have built a small area in the front of their home for the business so that María doesn't have to go and work outside the home and can take care of their little one who needs her attention.  María's husband is happy because, thanks to their efforts, they have a small business of their own which María is running very well and, in the future, they will be able to work there together.  Although the business is small, they plan to grow it a lot further.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 66 años de edad, es casada y radica junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola y bastante comercial situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a trabajar alquilando un equipo de sonido para amenizar diversas actividades sociales y culturales organizadas en la zona donde reside. Debido a la antiguedad del negocio cuenta actualmente con una clientela establecida que siempre solicita su servicio, principalmente los fines de semana. Los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Martha se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en el mantenimiento de sus equipos de sonido y en la compra de una nueva torre con parlantes, de modo que pueda repotenciar su negocio y mejorar el servicio que brinda.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito con nuestra institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos con nuestra institución. Ella goza de bastante respeto y buenas referencias en la zona donde reside.
texts.en:
Martha is 66 years old, married, and lives together with her husband in Cayaltí district.  This is an agricultural area which is also fairly commercial.  It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Martha's business is hiring out sound equipment for livening up different social and cultural events in her area.  As she has been in her business for a long time, she has an established customer base who always request her services, especially at weekends.  She uses the income that she makes in this business to help her husband support their family.

Martha is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles which she plans to use to maintain her sound equipment and buy a new speaker tower.  This will enable her to restrengthen her business and improve the service that she offers.

Martha has already received a loan from the institution and has shown herself to be a punctual and responsible client when it comes to making her repayments.  She has a lot of respect and good references from people in her area.

loans.use: to maintain her equipment and buy a new speaker tower to strengthen her business

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Masudi bought inventory of food to sell, including bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar. Selling these products helped him to slightly increase his working capital. Now Masudi is applying for a new Kiva loan. As his distributors develop an established clientele, they request more product, and Masudi's current working capital is insufficient to meet that growth in demand. 

Masudi says his Kiva loan will be successful for this reason. He will respond to his distributors' demand by buying more wheat flour, maize flour, and rice at a good price using the money from the loan. Masudi tells the lenders that his Kiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you, and asks that they may continue helping him.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Juana Jessica

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del banco comunal “Nuevo Edén” en el Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y no tiene hijos.
Lleva ocho años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa la cual implementó bien para poder trabajar con comodidad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprara: 5 paquetes de gaseosas descartables, 3 paquetes de agua mineral con gas, 2 paquetes de agua mineral sin gas, 4 cajas de gaseosas personales, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche chica, 1 caja de aceite.
Cada día esta mas implementada su bodega, también esta agregando lo que es pasamanería, está muy contenta porque puede tener sus propios ingresos y hacer  algunas mejoras en su hogar y también ayudar a su esposo que se desempeña como  asistente de sonido en una orquesta.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of “Nuevo Edén” Communal Bank in Yarinacocha District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old and married and does not have children. She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for eight years. She has a small store installed in her house which she opened in order to be able to work comfortably. With her new loan of S/. 1,500 she will buy 5 disposable packages of soda, 3 packages of carbonated mineral water, 2 packages of non-carbonated mineral water, 4 boxes of bottled soft drinks, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of small cartons of milk, 1 box of oil.

Her store is becoming better stocked every day. She is also adding accessories. She is very happy that she is able to have her own income and make some improvements to her home and also help her husband who works as an audio assistant for an orchestra.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, mineral water, milk and disposables.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 26 years old, married, and has one child. He resides in Caniangan, Tangub City, Philippines.

He operates a crops raising venture, planting and harvesting corn for sale in the local community to earn a living. In addition, he has a transport service business that has been in operation for two years. He earns on average 10,000 PHP every month from these businesses.

He has requested a loan of 11,900 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2010, Allan joined GDMPC and he wants to save money for the future as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 34 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es Carlos, de 42 años, con quien tiene tres hijos: Gladys de 15 años, Calos de 13 años y  Luis de 6 años. Viven en la casa que construyeron en un terreno donde se posesionaron.

Ella se dedica a la venta de artefactos usados, como televisores y radios, además de brindar el servicio de reparación. Todos los días, desde su vivienda abre su pequeño local donde espera a las personas que desean vender sus artefactos usados porque tienen algún desperfecto, luego lo arregla y los vuelven a poner a la venta. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 7 años y lo hace a lado de su pareja, quien se encargar de las reparaciones. Se siente muy bien con su trabajo, ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos, a parte de estar en su casa, poder ver y atender a sus hijos como ella desea. Al principio, cuando se iniciaron, tenían clientes sólo para reparación, pero con el pasar del tiempo los clientes dejaban sus artefactos y ellos los hacían funcionar y al pasar el tiempo los vendían, así es como nació la idea de empezar con ese negocio. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y además espera poder compenetrarse rápidamente con su banco comunal, del cual tiene muy buenas referencias por el compañerismo y solidaridad que existe entre ellos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará 20 artefactos, entre televisores y radios  usados, valorizados en 50 nuevos soles cada uno. También comprará repuestos y piezas para las reparaciones.
texts.en:
Gladys is 34 years old.  She is a nice, kind, very hard-working woman.  Her partner is 42-year-old Carlos and the couple have three children: 15-year-old Gladys, 13-year-old Carlos and 6-year-old Luis.  They live in a house that they built on a plot of land that they owned.

Gladys' business is selling used electronics such as television sets and radios.  She also provides repair services.  Every day she opens her small premises in her home and waits for people to come and sell their used appliances which are damaged in some way.  She fixes these appliances and then re-sells them.  She has been in this line of work for more than seven years and works alongside her partner who carries out the repairs.  She feels very happy with her work because it allows her to make good income from home.  This means she is able to watch over and care for her children as she would like to.  At first, when they started out in the business, Gladys and her partner only had customers for their repair service.  However, over time, customers would leave their appliances with them and they would make them work again and then later sell them.  This is how they came up with the idea to start this business.

This is Gladys' second loan from MFP.  She pledges to make her repayments punctually and also hopes to be able to build a good relationship with the other members of her community bank.  She has heard very good things about them owing to the camaraderie and solidarity that exists among them.

Gladys will use the 1,500 soles she has requested to buy 20 appliances: used televisions and radios, which cost 50 soles each.  She will also buy spare parts which she needs to make the repairs.

loans.use: to buy 20 appliances to fix and sell, and to buy spare parts

loans.name: Jose De Las Nieves

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su amada esposa y sus 3 queridos hijos; él es una persona muy amable, entusiasta y trabajador, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, José puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de adobes, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana José asiste a un pequeño terreno arrendado para iniciar la elaboración de adobes, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien debido a su buen trabajo y buena atención.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del alquiler del terreno y también podrá realizar la compra de maderas y moldes para la elaboración de sus adobes; de esta manera José contará con las herramientas necesarias para el mejor desarrollo de su negocio, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea poder utilizar para asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos, ya que sueña verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien y así en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder tener su casa propia y una fábrica de ladrillos.
texts.en:
José is a 40 year old man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with his beloved wife and three children. He is a very friendly person, enthusiastic and a hard worker, who dedicates all of his efforts to getting his family ahead. Unfortunately, because of his need to work to pay his expenses starting when he was very young, he could not pursue a professional career, but he would have liked to study the degree of business administration. In his free time he likes to watch educational programs and sometimes he cooks a rich rice with duck to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and thanks to the support of his family, José put in motion his little business selling adobe. Each day, starting very early in the morning, José attends to a small plot of leased land  to begin the creation of adobe. He spends approximately 10 hours each day working on his business. He feels comfortable doing his work and believes that it will go well thanks to his hard work and careful attention. 

José feels very grateful for the Kiva loans now that, thanks to the help they provide, he will be able to cover the expenses of the rent of his land. He will also be able to buy wood and molds for the creation of adobe. Now, José can count on the tools he needs to improve the development of his business. With them he hopes to increase his sales and increase his economic revenue which he hopes to use to secure the education and well being of his small children whom he dreams of seeing converted into good professionals and great men. In the not so distant future he hopes to have his own house and a brick making factory.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of renting land and to buy wood and molds.
